Description: The most famous beach resort of the Turkish Mediterranean coast, Antalya offers enjoyable golden beaches and endless possibilities for water sports fans. There are also charming historical sights to be admired, fascinating sea caves to be explored, and the Taurus Mountains forming a spectacular background for the friendly Turkish resort of Antalya.

Of all the tropical islands of Indonesia, Bali is the best known tourism destination, and surely for a reason. The inexpensive Bali hosts great beaches as well as excellent surfing and diving conditions. This tropical island destinatiopn offers also lovely landscape with palm trees, lush forests and volcanic mountains. The many hot springs and spas, and the intriguing exotic culture and ancient Hindu traditions of Bali make the island, known also as the Island of Gods, a truly magical place!

A remote tropical paradise off the coast of Brazil, Fernando de Noronha is a small archipelago of 21 islands in the Atlantic Ocean and a UNESCO World Heritage site offering some of the best diving and surfing in Brazil, as well as pristine beaches and unique wildlife. Most of the islands and coral reefs of Fernando de Noronha are being protected as a marine park, and they have become a popular ecotourism destination. To keep the tourism in Fernando de Noronha sustainable, the number of visitors is restricted to about 420 at a time.

Known as the Pearl of the Orient or the food paradise of Asia, The Malaysian island of Penang offers an intriguing blend of cultures and cuisines, as well as sandy beaches, a mountainous jungle-clad interior, and great possibilities for shopping. Penang is also home to impressive Buddhist temples and World Heritage -listed colonial architecture.

The Andaman Islands, an archipelago in the Bay of Bengal, are wonderfully varied and lush with palm trees and all kinds of other tropical trees, and are a paradise for nature lovers who want to spot wild animals and swim in crystal clear waters. Diving here is some of the best you will ever try, especially from December to March when visibility is at its best. Other water sports popular in the area include surfing, snorkeling and trekking: the beaches are mostly wild and usually fairly empty, so they are perfect to relax and rest and become one with nature.

If you want to see the real Cuba beyond Varadero and other resort areas, why not visit Santiago de Cuba with its historic downtown, wide range of museums, cultural attractions and nightlife options? This vibrant second largest city in Cuba is the home of the Cuban revolution and Son music, as well as many prominent Cuban artists and national heroes, and the nearby Baconao Park offers both historical sights and nature attractions.

The hilly and remote Yasawa islands are blessed with lush and rugged nature, offer many beautiful natural and cultural sites as well as the best opportunities for kayaking in the area. The archipelago is composed of about 20 islands, but here you won’t find much, as there are no roads, stores or cars anywhere in sight. The beaches are, of course, wild and beautiful, virtually empty and perfect for those seeking seclusion: there isn’t much to do on the islands, but if you are seeking for haven of tranquility to rest, relax, and feel one with nature, this is the ideal destination for you.

Sun and beaches! That is what the recipe of Costa del Sol is made of. With more than 300 sunny days a year, this coastal region in Southern Spain is the perfect spot to place your sunbed and enjoy beach life with excellent facilities for water sports and golf waiting to be tested. If you want a day off the beach, try shopping in your resort, or enjoy the historical sights of the main city in Costa del Sol, Malaga. If you have any energy left after the sun sets, head for one of the numerous discos and nightclubs offered in Costa del Sol tourist resorts of Torremolinos, Fuengirola and Marbella.

Guadeloupe is a tropical French Caribbean archipelago with a versatile landscape of white-sand beaches, blue sea, waterfalls, hot springs, volcanoes, and mountains covered with tropical forests. Therefore, diving and hiking are among the most popular activities in Guadeloupe. In the modern cities and luxurious beach resorts of Guadeloupe you can taste the delicious Creole cuisine and local rum. The relaxed atmosphere on these French-speaking paradise islands is a fascinating blend of French and Caribbean traditions.

Historical attractions, deep blue sea, sandy beaches, and water sports are the main attractions in sunny Larnaca, the oldest city in Cyprus. The beautiful palm-fringed beach promenade of Larnaca is dotted with cafes, taverns, shops and bars. The small coastal city of Larnaca is also an ideal base for exploring other destinations in Cyprus.

Water sports in the turquoise Mediterranean Sea, sunbathing on the beach, sightseeing in the ancient medina and bargaining in the colorful souq are all popular activities in the lively Tunisian seaside city of Sousse. One of the most famous holiday destinations in Tunisia, Sousse and the nearby resort town of Port El Kantaoui have pleasant Mediterranean climate and excellent accommodation and dining opportunities.

A Coastal city in Northwestern Spain close to the French border and the Pyrenees, San Sebastian is a beach holiday destination and a lively Basque city all in the same spot. Many come here for the joys of sandy beaches and sea views, but just as many enjoy the modern city facilities and explore the historical sights of San Sebastian.

The beautiful Southeast corner of Sicily is home to many famous and wonderful towns, from stunning Siracusa, to picture perfect Noto and Modica. The beaches and nature around the towns are also of rare beauty and definitely worth a visit even if your main focus is not lounging in the sun. Here you will find many baroque churches and palazzos, and tons of little villages scattered on the hills that characterize this area. As there is so much to see in the area, the best way to enjoy it is by renting a car, so you are free to roam from place to place at your own pace. The closest airport is Catania.

Description: White-sand beaches bordered with shading palm trees, rolling rice fields, and lovely fishing villages surrounded by exciting tropical jungle with its natural wonders. Langkawi, a group of several small islands located in the Indian Ocean off the west coast of Malaysia, has all what it takes to create a tropical holiday paradise.

Swakopmund is a beautiful coastal town in Namibia with seaside promenades, fine beaches, and colonial buildings. The surrounding Namib Desert offers great opportunities for adventure sports, including skydiving, quadbiking, and sandboarding. There are also good chances to spot pelicans, pink flamingos and dolphins around Swakopmund, and to go on exciting camel rides or hot air balloon safaris. Swakopmund is a good base for trips to other fascinating Namibian destinations, including the isolated Skeleton Coast.

The rocky island of Folegandros, with its uninterrupted stunning views and rugged nature, is only 12 kilometers long and a picture-perfect oasis of calm in a sea of blue. Just one road of roughly 10 kilometers connects the Karavostasis port to Hora and Ano Meria, the only three quaint white villages on the island. Here, life moves at a different, slower pace and offers the perfect place to relax by the Mediterranean: no wonder Folegandros is a top choice for those seeking peace and quiet. Imagine walking in the quiet alleys of the Hora, or stopping in a square to enjoy the shade and scent of centennial bougainvillea trees: the very essence of the island seems to be made of relaxation. Step on its high cliffs, take in some dramatic landscapes and let the island capture you with its austere beauty; Folegandros has lovely beaches but they can sometimes be difficult to reach if you are not prepared to walk. A good alternative is taking a water taxi to find your favorite spot.

An Australian diving paradise, the Great Barrier Reef is the largest coral reef complex in the world. One of the major tourist attractions in Australia, it offers wonderful opportunities for observing the unique Australian underwater world by snorkeling and diving in Great Barrier Reef in warm, crystal clear waters of the Coral Sea. Glass bottom boat tours in the reef are also organized by several tour operators.

With its pastel colors, marble churches and low-key, laid-back atmosphere, Foggia is a pleasant and relaxing choice for a long weekend or a holiday. The town has many beautiful churches and buildings to see, and for those seeking some gastronomical delights, eateries and restaurants are plenty and serving amazing local specialties. The area just outside Foggia, the Tavoliere, is a flat, rugged land with a very different and unique feel to it.

The amazing Similian Islands are well known around the world by those who enjoy crystal clear waters with incredible visibility conditions, so it’s perfect for passionate snorkelers and divers. The islands have been declared a Marine National Park thanks to their amazing coral reefs and underwater fauna: if you want to feel one with nature, this is definitely a destination you should consider. There isn’t much to do on the islands at night, so if nightlife is your thing, look elsewhere.

South African beach city with enjoyable water sport facilities by the warm Indian Ocean waters, well-maintained tourist services, and active city life, Durban is one of the major attractions of South Africa. Thanks to the diverse zoological attractions of the city and the scenic nature and cultural villages found in its surroundings, Durban offers plenty of things to see also for nature lovers.

Over three hundred tiny islands scattered into the crystal blue water of the Caribbean Sea next to the coastline of Panama, the remote San Blas Islands hide not only a natural paradise for diving and beach holidays, but also a fascinating culture of the Kuna Indians who own and live on these unique self-governing islands.

Have you ever thought of travelling to a far away island for taking a break from your everyday routines? The island would be surrounded by sandy beaches, where you can enjoy endless sunshine and lay on a sun-bed with a glass of refreshing drink and maybe a good book to be enjoyed at times. Looking further towards the sea, you would discover clear blue water with unimaginably rich marine life, in another words there would be a true diver’s paradise waiting for you - as it is in Perhentian islands of Malaysia!

Standing where the Mediterranean meets the Aegean Sea, Marmaris enjoys long sandy beaches, turquoise seawater and guaranteed sunshine. This popular holiday resort in Turkey also offers idyllic landscapes of fishing villages and coastal areas, with sea cliffs framing the coast and traditional fishing boats gliding on the sea.

Would you like to enjoy lovely sand dunes and fascinating lunar landscapes, or enjoy an astonishing number of sandy beaches suitable for water sports? Do you think it would be time to feel the sunlight in your face and have a good old beach holiday under the warm Spanish sun? Maybe you would also love to try some water sports? If the answer is yes, the island of Fuerteventura might be a good place for experiencing this all and much more.

Long white beaches, stunning cliffs, blue waters and an easy going atmosphere: the Riviera del Corallo is all this and much, much more. If you are looking for interesting tows to visit, Alghero and Sassari will definitely strike a chord with you, while the wild beauty and rich history of the Asinara island is perfect for those who want to explore a truly unique destination. Foodies will fall in love with the abundance and quality of the local lobsters, to be washed down with the delicious wines produced in the region, while sun lovers have a lot of beaches to choose from. Alghero, the region’s hub, will definitely leave you in awe with its Cataln roots and unique traditions.

With its wild and lush nature, the Caramoan peninsula is a dream come true for those who love to be surrounded by a thick jungle with great sea views. The coast offers pristine sandy beaches and amazing azure seas and is perfect for relaxing in solitude, except during weekends, when it becomes a popular destination with Filipino tourists that flock from the cities. Those who want to stay active during their holiday can rock climb, hike, and kayak, while those who want to try something a little less adventurous can enjoy a boat tour to the nearby islands.

Sunny city along the French Riviera, Cannes is famous mainly for its annual film festival. This lively seaside town on the Mediterranean coast of France is also a place to go for sunbathing, entertainment, and water sports. As for historical attractions, Cannes offers an interesting old town, a traditional monastery, and a good deal of tales connected with local history. Cannes lies at the foot of the French Sea Alps that invite you to try diverse activities from scenic car touring to trekking, biking and more.

Famous worldwide since the 17th century, Taormina and the surrounding area are a true gem on the Ionian coast and are, to this day, one of the most visited destinations in Sicily. Taormina, perched on the hills overlooking a sea of blue, is not only very pretty, but also interesting to those who enjoy nature and history. Here you will find numerous ruins that date back to the Greek domination, such as the Ancient Theatre, but you will also find plenty of lush and natural landscapes to soak in the relaxing atmosphere.

A chic French Caribbean island with world-class beaches, designer shopping, sports fishing, diving and snorkeling in shallow coral reefs: This is Saint Barthelemy, a secluded yachting paradise and a tax-free royalty and rock-star hideaway in the sunny tropical Caribbean, offering also excellent opportunities for sailing, surfing, windsurfing, tennis and horseback riding.

Chania is said to be one of the most interesting and beautiful towns in Crete, and in all of Greece thanks to its idyllic location on the north shore of the island and its amazing history and architecture. The town is charming and amazing to explore, with quaint alleys heading to the port – one of the most picturesque in the country. Here you will find yourself endlessly strolling, taking pictures, enjoying a drink or browsing the stores selling local artifacts. Those who enjoy life at the beach won’t be disappointed, as the area offers some incredible places to enjoy the clear waters that surround the island: from super organized structures with chairs and umbrellas to wilder, more remote beaches, the area has it all. Around Chania you can also enjoy incredible historical sites, from castles and fortresses to stunning Ottoman landmarks, as well beautiful mountains, gorges and lakes.

A speck of white in the blue waters of the Aegean, Amorgos is a stunning island with high peaks and vivid landscapes that mesmerizes visitors at first sight. Its timeless beauty, rugged nature and love for tradition make it one of the most mysterious islands of the Cyclades. Amorgos is an island worth discovering, although this discovery might not always come easy. Small and quiet, Amorgos is the ideal island to indulge in some rest and relaxation away from the crowds and happening nightlife that characterize some other Greek islands. The stunning monastery of Hozoviotissa, the island’s top attraction, is an iconic construction that leaves visitors breathless, not only because of the steep steps that lead to the entrance; other trekking paths make Amorgos popular with those who enjoy wearing their hiking boots instead of their bathing suits.

The second largest city in Croatia, Split is a Mediterranean coastal city with a spectacular UNESCO World Heritage -nominated Old Town with a Roman Palace, walls, squares and temples. The beach boulevards of Split are lined with palm trees, cafes, and restaurants. Located on the shores of the blue Adriatic Sea, Split offers great sailing conditions and is also good base for exploring the picturesque Adriatic islands of Croatia.

A tiny twin island state in the Caribbean with guaranteed sunshine and full glory of tropical nature strongly present, Saint Kitts and Nevis are a good choice for anyone wanting to enjoy quiet palm-framed beaches, make adventurous hikes in the rainforest, or relax with a glass of dark rum watching the sun set over the Caribbean Sea.

One of the most beautiful cities in the world, Sydney is the largest and oldest city of Australia and the capital of New South Wales. Sydney is a cosmopolitan and multicultural city that offers something for everyone. The city has a wide cultural and entertainment scene and many activities for visitors, such as sightseeing and shopping. Situated in the Southeast coast of Australia by the Pacific Ocean, the city is also famous as the home of the huge Sydney Harbour and wonderful white beaches.

If you are dreaming of white sands and crystal clear waters, the amazing islands of Koh Rong and Kph Rong Sanloem are an ideal destination for you: here you can get in touch with unspoiled Cambodian nature and enjoy the beautiful and lush vegetation of Southeast Asia at its best. Snorkeling and diving lovers will fall in love with the diverse and stunning underwater world of this area. This is also a place to rest and relax: the atmosphere is laid back and low key, and staying at a bungalow with sea views is one of the most incredible ways for recharging and feeling one with nature. The most amazing beaches on the islands are: Sok San Beach, Sokha Beach,  Serendipity Beach, and Otres Beach.

Flanked by dramatic mountains and bordering the crystal-clear waters of the Gulf of Oman, Muscat, the capital of Oman is a fascinating blend of old and new: there are colorful souqs, spectacular mosques, medieval forts next to modern malls and world-class hotels. In addition, Muscat is home to long, sandy beaches and a great variety of outdoor activities that can be enjoyed nearby.

The laidback and sunny capital of the Bahamas, Nassau offers its visitors plenty of white sand beaches, great tax-free shopping and vibrant nightlife. In Nassau you can also enjoy water sports, casinos, golf courses and great opportunities for fishing and diving in the crystal-clear Bahamian waters - all this located conveniently close to Florida and the East coast of the US.

A tropical Caribbean paradise island of Isla Margarita is home to turquoise sea and long, white-sand beaches fringed with coconut palms that are ideal for sunbathing, as well as windsurfing and other water sports activities. One of the most popular holiday destinations in Venezuela, Isla de Margarita offers good opportunities for duty-free shopping and island-hopping to the picturesque nearby islands.

Famous for the novel and the movie Captain Corelli’s Mandolin, the sunny Greek island of Kefalonia is home to breathtaking scenery with azure blue sea, idyllic bays, secluded beaches, high cliffs, impressive mountains, underground lakes, secret caves, verdant vineyards, and olive groves. In addition, there are lovely harbors, picturesque fishing villages and delicious Greek cuisine to explore in Kefalonia.

The tropical paradise islands of Palawan are home to exceptional natural beauty with white beaches, sheltered bays and underground rivers. One of the best scuba diving sites in the world, Palawan hosts coral reefs, wrecks, and colorful marine life. These Southeast Asian islands are also an outdoor adventure wonderland with jungles, mountains, underground rivers, magical lakes, and rich flora and fauna just waiting to be explored.

These two neighboring town of the French Riviera, despite being so close, are very different from each other: Antibes is a quiet and quaint town, once a favorite of Picasso, while Juan-les-Pins is its modern and glitzy counterpart, well know for its jazz festival and its swanky nightlife. Most hotels are located in the latter, while in the former you will find luxury villas, boutiques and al fresco dining options. Both are very charming, and perfect for those who are seeking a sophisticated yet gun destination for their summer holidays.

With guaranteed sunshine, white-sand beaches and clear blue seas, the Caribbean island of Aruba is one of the places meant for a beach holiday. However, this Dutch Caribbean island has also many historical and natural attractions to please your eye, as well as excellent water sport facilities to suit the taste of the active outdoor people.

Cebu, the most densely populated island in the Philippines, has become a top tourist attraction in the past few years and sees an incredible number of visitors attracted by its beautiful white sandy beaches, tropical climate and fun atmosphere. If you are in search of a lively nightlife scene, Cebu City is the place for you, filled with bars, lounges and clubs. If you prefer to be in contact with nature, on the other hand, the southwest coast of the island is a real paradise for those who enjoy swimming and diving in crystal clear waters and along palm lined beaches.

Largest island in the Indian Ocean, so near to the rhythm and beauty of Africa, and yet with so many unique natural and cultural features, Madagascar demands all of your attention. With its incredible indigenous flora and fauna, most of which can be found nowhere else in the world, and diverse landscape of jungles, beaches and mountains, Madagascar sure is something special!

Famous for its excellent diving and snorkeling sites, the Egyptian Red Sea resort town of Sharm el-Sheikh is also a big beach holiday destination. Besides diving and snorkeling in the clear waters of the Red Sea and sunbathing on the long sandy beaches enjoying guaranteed sunshine, there are plenty of activities in Sharm el-Sheikh, from golf and water sports to nightlife, shopping, and excursions to the deserts and mountains of the Sinai Peninsula.

Imagine a modern and wealthy Arabic city with white sand beaches, sunshine, world-class shopping and luxurious hotels. Add some vibrant nightlife, historic sights, marinas, dive sites and jeep safaris in the desert dunes and you will get an idea of what Dubai in the United Arab Emirates offers.

The Caribbean island of Saint Martin is an inviting tropical getaway with great beaches, casinos, duty free shopping, sailing and water sports from surfing and windsurfing to waterskiing, fishing and parasailing. In addition to these attractions, St Martin also has an interesting history, festive nightlife and a great amount of nice restaurants to choose from, so it is no wonder why this small island receives over a million vacationing visitors every year.

An exotic tropical holiday destination with vast unspoiled beaches, sand dunes, coral reefs with excellent diving and snorkeling ,and some of the best game fishing in Africa – Bazaruto Islands of Mozambique offer all this and more. These peaceful islands are an untouched paradise that is also great for horseback riding and birdwatching, not to forget the spectacular Indian Ocean sunsets!

Sunny coastal town along the Indian Ocean coast of South Africa, Jeffreys Bay is a fantastic destination for surfing. Aside from surfing sites and facilities, the town offers also a wide line of white sand beaches for sunbathing. After a day out on the beach or surfing in Jeffreys Bay, you can test the facilities of local nightlife. When wanting a break from all the surfing, visit the nearby city of Port Elizabeth or the beloved Addo Elephant National Park with its wild African animals.

The state of Goa is the premier beach holiday destination in India. This scenic region that is said to be the easy introduction to India is home to excellent beaches, affordable shopping, popular nightlife, interesting historical sites, and wildlife sanctuaries. Goa is popular especially among young people and families looking for enjoyable beach surroundings.

Description: Don’t let the size of Jost Van Dyke fool you: this tiny islet is not only beautiful, but is also a favorite destination with many rich and famous visitors. There isn’t much on the island: covered in lush jungle, blessed with white powdery sand, Jost is a dream come true for those seeking a true Caribbean paradise. Here visitors will find a few pretty guesthouses, some restaurants, and a very famous beach bar that has been attracting travellers for decades thanks to its picture perfect background, se facing hammocks and amazingly laid back atmosphere.

The amazing island of La Digue is a real tropical paradise, with a sea of green, blue skies and perfect white sand: no wonder it has become one of the most loved destinations for honeymooners and beach lovers. Here you can spend relaxing days by the surf, just taking in the incredible beauty of your surroundings, or you can choose to actively enjoy nature and explore the island with a hiking tour on one of the many walking paths that crisscross it. If you are not quite so in shape, a boat excursion is a great alternative to discover the beauty of  the island; scuba diving and snorkeling, too, are wonderful in the area, as there are plenty of wonderful reefs and coral gardens to be explored.

The cosmopolitan Cuban capital Havana is a swinging tropical city with vibrant nightlife, fascinating Old Town, and famous sights such as Havana Cigar Factory and Museum of Revolution. The largest city in Cuba and the whole Caribbean region, Havana is a versatile historical city destination and the best possible choice for a traveler who wants to explore the local culture of Cuba.

Lesser known than the other areas in Tuscany, the Argentario promontory takes its name from the eponymous mountain, and overlooks a long stretch of beautiful coast surrounded by a lush and amazing nature. Both sandy and rocky, the beaches in this area are known for their beauty and wilderness, while the waters are clear and perfect for swimming. The area is great for a large number of activities, including hiking and biking, and it’s the getaway to some of the most beautiful islands in Italy, such as Giglio, Elba and Montecristo, very popular with sailors looking for a relaxing sailboat vacation. Porto Ercole and Porto Santo Stefano are the town main towns in the Argentario, where you can find most of the accommodation options, restaurants and activities.

Want to learn to dive in affordable tropical paradise-like surroundings? Well, then Koh Tao is just the place for you! This small island in Thailand is surrounded by shallow coral reefs and is one of the world's most popular as well as cheapest places to take diving courses to attain the open water dive certification. This attracts wannabe divers to Koh Tao from around the globe. Koh Tao is also home to sandy beaches, lively nightlife, and great possibilities for snorkeling, sailing and game fishing.

The Bahamian islands of Eleuthera and Harbour Islands are a dream come true for those who love stunning beaches, beautiful water and a stylish atmosphere: here the sand is an amazing shade of pink, snorkeling and diving are at their best, and peace and quiet are everywhere. Visitors fall in love with the quaint pastel colored cottages, the palm lined stretches of sand and the friendliness of the locals: there is much to explore on these islands, so take your time and enjoy the sites, as there is much to be delighted from around these beautiful and upscale islands.

Thanks to its fine white sand, clear blue waters and amazing nature, Ngwe Saung Beach is one of Myanmar’s best-loved seaside resorts and is becoming increasingly popular with visitors from all around the world. Its refined atmosphere and sophisticated accommodation options, its 13 miles of beaches and its vicinity to Yangon attract more and more high end travelers each year, but certain spots in the south are still a favorite with budget minded backpackers.

Inhambane Province in Mozambique is known for its excellent beaches as well as good opportunities for diving and snorkeling. The pretty historical town of Inhambane offers charming colonial architecture and affordable shopping for local products, while the coastal resorts in Inhambane Province such as Praia do Tofo, Praia dos Cocos, and Ponto do Barra are perfect for relaxing beach holidays. Still undiscovered by mass tourism, Inhambane region is becoming popular as a diving destination.

The sunny beach resort city of Florianopolis in Southern Brazil is known for its multitude of excellent white sand beaches and surfing possibilities. This island city also hosts historic forts and colonial buildings, beautiful waterfalls and lagoons, and plenty of opportunities for nightlife and shopping. Other activities in Florianopolis include diving, mountain biking and paragliding.

Country: United States of America: Hawaii USA
Description: Kauai, the Garden Island of Hawaii is well known for its stunning landscapes that have been featured in more than 70 Hollywood movies and TV shows. Natural wonders of Kauai include Waimea Canyon, Na Pali Coast and Mount Waialeale, which is known as one of the rainiest areas in the world. This green island also hosts the greatest number of beaches in Hawaiian Islands, excellent surfing conditions, as well as scenic waterfalls, mountains and lush rainforests that provide for great trekking or biking experiences.

Rio de Janeiro is the world's most famous beach city. Simply known as Rio, this Brazilian city of vivid colors offers you world-famous white sand beaches filled with life and good opportunities for surfing and paragliding, as well as raucous nightlife and a world-renowned carnival in Rio that is held annually in February. Rio’s interesting blend of cultures and cuisines plus several historical attractions are some additional reasons for it being such a popular travel destination.

The tiny Djibouti in the Horn of Africa offers great diving experiences as well as beaches, volcanoes, whale watching, luxury hotels, empty deserts, salt lakes and coral reefs rich in marine life. Rarely visited by tourists, Djibouti is now trying to reinvent itself as the new international travel destination along the Red Sea. It is wild and rich of  cultural heritage and it offers something rather precious for the adventure enthusiasts !

Famous for its full moon parties, the small island of Koh Phangan in Thailand is a great place for relaxing beach holidays, offering many secluded, palm-fringed beaches and a wide range of affordable beachside accommodations from simple beach huts to resort hotels. Diving and snorkeling around Koh Phangan are very good, and you can also go trekking or fishing, ride an elephant, relax with massage or yoga, or try a variety of sports from Thai boxing to archery and wakeboarding.

The Caribbean island nation of Saint Lucia is renowned for its beautiful beaches, luxury hotels and scenic green mountains. St. Lucia is a fashionable tropical vacation destination for honeymooners with many activities available from diving and windsurfing to duty-free shopping, and from trekking and horseback riding to tennis and golf. The two green peaks of the Pitons are the island’s famous scenic landmark.

A charming coastal town between the clear blue waters of the Adriatic Sea and the towering Biokovo Mountain in the Dalmatian coast of Croatia, Makarska hosts a palm-fringed beach promenade, a beautiful old town, and a lovely harbour. On the pebble beaches of the Makarska Riviera holiday region you can sunbathe, swim, or try water sports. If you are looking for some outdoor adventures, head for the impressive Mount Biokovo. With the combination of sun, beaches and beautiful mountain landscapes, it is no wonder this picturesque Mediterranean town attracts tens of thousands of visitors a year.

It’s hard not to fall in love with the stunning island of Milos, featuring more than 70 beaches. Famous for being the place where the beautiful Aphrodite statue of the same name, today housed in the Louvre Museum, was found, Milos is the westernmost island of the Cyclades, with a total surface of 151 sq. km. and, because of its volcanic origin, it can boast landscapes so beautiful they look unreal, a wide range of colors, amazing rock formations and water with striking hues of blue. Blessed with incredible beauty and a rich history, Milos is an island of quaint fishing villages, dramatically high cliffs, vast olive groves and wild rugged mountains. There is absolutely no way to get bored in Milos: in fact, there is so much to do that it is advisable to dedicate many days to really get to explore and get to know this amazing island.

An exotic diving and beach destination in the Philippines, Puerto Galera on the island of Mindoro is home to excellent long beaches by the clean and turquoise South China Sea. A top diving destination of the Philippines, Puerto Galera offers excellent water sports opportunities, and the unexplored mountain ranges around the town have trekking routes with breathtaking views over the sea.

It’s hard if not impossible not to fall in love with picture-perfect Portofino, with it pastel colored houses overlooking the impossibly charming harbor. Surrounded by beautiful lush woods, Portofino is a place to see and be seen, with chic restaurants and bars, and an overall refines yet relaxed atmosphere. From the small marina you can catch the hourly boats to the beautiful Abbey of San Fruttouso or to the beaches in nearby Santa Margherita and Rapallo, where most of the action is also at night.

A remote European island destination full of amazing natural beauty from glittering lakes to scenic mountains, blue lagoons, and green pastures, the Azores are an excellent destination for thoe who love nature. This Portuguese archipelago, located in the Atlantic Ocean, offers you the joys of several outdoor sports from sailing and hiking to golf, whale watching and much more.

Tropical island enjoying the best gifts of the Caribbean sun, Bonaire offers pleasant climate and landscapes of turquoise sea and scenic coast formations. This sunny Dutch Caribbean island is best known for its excellent facilities for scuba diving, but also the flamingos and tropical landscapes of Bonaire offer plenty of attractions to be enjoyed. The north coast of Bonaire offers great windsurfing conditions as well.

Forming an idyllic meeting place of the sea and mountains, Santander in the north of Spain is a city of possibilities. Should you want to walk the streets of a historically interesting and less touristic Spanish town or relax on sunny beaches, you are welcome. At the same time you could also learn how to sail or try golf in the scenic courses of Santander. Around the city there are mountains waiting for you with their lovely facilities for biking, trekking and much more.

A stunning archipelago of 15 islands, Con Dao is a gem of incredible beauty ready to be discovered. Quiet and secluded, the islands feature amazing coral reefs that will make divers and snorkelers fall in love, and powdery white beaches for those who just want to rest and relax in the sun. The islands also have an incredible wildlife, and are an ideal destination for those who want to feel one with nature during their holiday. Once used to imprison political subversives, today the islands are becoming more and more popular and are a must see in Vietnam if you truly want to enjoy the country’s lush nature.

South African coastal city with golden beaches, good water sport facilities, and lively nightlife, Port Elizabeth is a great destination for beach holidays. Port Elizabeth is also located close to one of the best-known South African wildlife parks, Addo Elephant Park, which is an excellent place for spotting not only elephants but also many other African wild animals in their natural surroundings.

A volcanic island with a mild climate, enjoyable beaches, and comfortable tourist services, Lanzarote enjoys a status of a top beach holiday destination for a reason. In addition to sun bathing, beaches, and water sports, this small Spanish island also offers you the stunning volcanic landscapes of the Timanfaya National Park and a wide variety of theme parks planned to please the youngest of the family.

The metropolitan, vibrant and exciting City of Angels, Los Angeles in Southern California is the home of the famous Hollywood and the world capital of entertainment, offering a variety of options from famous amusement parks to concerts and nightlife. In addition, L.A. offers excellent beaches, great sightseeing options, excellent shopping, dining and outdoor activities. Enjoying one of the most pleasant climates in the world, L.A. attracts visitors year-round from all over the world. In short, Los Angeles has it all!

Exotic Kota Kinabalu on the island of Borneo introduces you to not only the wonders of tropical jungle and the joys of a beach holiday, but also the highest mountain of Malaysia, Mount Kinabalu, which with its altitude of 4,100 meters is a majestic sight and for many also a target of a climbing tour. Interesting local cultures and marine life around Kota Kinabalu are also worth exploring.

Sandy beaches, sunny climate, fresh Portuguese sea air, and beautiful landscape with sea cliffs and green countryside - these are the basic ingredients of Algarve's magnetism, which draws millions of visitors to enjoy the facilities of this popular coastal area in the southernmost corner of Portugal. The Algarve region is a great destination for beach holidays under the warm Portuguese sun. Golf is a particularly popular outdoor sport in Algarve.

Nestled between Chania and Heraklio, Rhetymno and the area that surrounds it have a mix of characteristics of their neighbors: there is palm trees and sandy beaches, but also Venetian architecture and old villages steeped in tradition. Agia Pelagia, with its easygoing atmosphere, is great for relaxing close to all comforts, while the sandy cove of Ammoudi is best for those who want to spend a quiet day by the water. The old town of Rhetymno itself has a nice fishing port and a very pleasant atmosphere, and is especially pretty at sunset, but is also worth stopping at for dinner, as here you will find a vast array of dining options.

Cape Town is known for being a great outdoor city, and Camps Bay, only a stone throw’s away from town, is home to some excellent beaches, perfect for sunbathing and, as well as to some windy areas attracting surfers. With Table Mountain on the background with its unique, world Heritage -listed nature, rock climbers will find suitable surroundings for their hobby. All this combined with Cape of Good Hope, Cape Wine region and the refreshing parks of the city make this area an incredible outdoor wonderland and an excellent gateway to South African wilderness.

Sosua is one of the most popular beach vacation destinations in Dominican Republic. This sunny small town offers great possibilities for water sports such as snorkeling and windsurfing, activities such as horseback riding and rafting, or just having a relaxing beach holiday. The beaches in Sosua have calm turquoise waters and white sand, and of course plenty of resort hotels to choose from.

Historically important and architecturally interesting seaside city in Southern France, Marseille is a city worth visiting. It does not matter whether you want to explore the French city life or the Mediterranean sun, admire architectural attractions, enjoy cultural entertainment, or try the shopping possibilities of a big European city, Marseille is ready. While in Marseille don’t miss the opportunity to visit Les Calanques, a real gem not far from the city. Here you will find a picture perfect landscape with 20 kilometers of spectacular coast that will strike a chord with nature and sports lovers.

Northern Mariana Islands in the Western Pacific Ocean are tropical holiday paradises with turquoise waters and stunning white beaches great for sunbathing and water sports such as diving and snorkeling. The variable landscape of these Micronesian islands with beaches, volcanoes, jungles and waterfalls is waiting to be explored by hiking and the casinos on the islands offer entertainment for gamblers.

Remote Caribbean islands with beautiful beaches, excellent dive sites and interesting history and local culture, San Andrés and Providencia are small tropical island hideaways with plenty of sun, sea and water sports, uninhabited small cays to discover, as well as a varied wildlife to be seen. They are also a great place for tropical island weddings. Although San Andrés has become favorite vacation spot for Central and South American visitors, these Colombian islands are yet less known in the English-speaking world.

With its beautiful beaches and crystal clear waters of the Adriatic Sea, the island of Brac in Croatia is a perfect destination for a relaxing summer holiday. This sunny Dalmatian island has good possibilities for water sports and unspoiled nature with rolling hills, pine forests and vineyards just waiting to be explored. Besides outdoor activities, Brac also hosts some fascinating historical attractions to admire.

Secluded and quiet, The Exumas are a group of amazing islands in The Bahamas, characterized by stunning landscapes, long white beaches and some of the most azure waters you will ever see. Upscale and refined, they are home to some of the country’s most exclusive hotels and resorts, featuring palm lines stretches of powdery sand and an astonishing underwater fauna, dear to snorkelers and divers. The crowning jewel of The Exumas is the Exuma Cays Land and Sea Park, a real wonder for those who want to enjoy the beautiful nature of the Caribbean.

The beautiful and remote islands of the Lakshadweep archipelago are located off the southwest coast of the Indian subcontinent and have been a favorite holiday destination for Indians since the 1970s, and they are know becoming popular with international travellers as well. Here you will find blue waters, lush vegetation and beautiful white beaches, as well as a great variety of water sports for those who want to keep active while on vacation: diving, wind surfing, snorkeling, water skiing and fishing are just some of the activities available in the area. As for accommodation, you will find some resorts as well as some apartments for rent.

The cultural capital of Australia, Melbourne hosts numerous theatres, operas and sports events, and you can find also popular concerts in Melbourne. The beautiful city centre of Melbourne is home to historic buildings from the Victorian era and museums which display the fascinating aboriginal history of Australia. There are endless opportunities for shopping in Melbourne in the abundant malls and boutiques of the city.

It’s difficult to describe Napoli in just a few words, as this city, with its contradictions, colorful quarters, crazy traffic and intense pace is a world on its own. The views from the city over the sea and the Vesuvio are unique, as are the beautiful palazzos and churches that dot the town center. Napoli’s surroundings include many interesting, must-see sights such as Ercolano and Pompeii, not to mention the stunning Reggia di Caserta and quaint Capua.

The main island of the Spanish Canary Islands, Gran Canaria is known for its sunny weather and lovely beaches, among them the world-wide famous sand dunes of Maspalomas. Apart from ideal surroundings for beach holidays and well-maintained tourism services, this Spanish sunbathing paradise also offers stunning volcanic landscapes, good entertainment and shopping facilities, and lots of organized possibilities for outdoor sports, making Gran Canaria a highly popular holiday destination.

Tropical seaside resort town of Playa del Carmen in the Caribbean coast of Mexico is known for its white sand beaches and vibrant nightlife, but this party town locals call just Playa also hosts shopping centers and nearby coastal theme parks. Perfect for beach vacations, Playa del Carmen offers great opportunities for activities such as snorkeling, diving, sailing and deep-sea fishing, and day trips to the nearby historic ruins or scenic islands.

The third largest city in Australia, Brisbane in Queensland is one of the fastest growing cities in Australia with excellent museums, wide music scene and good shopping in Brisbane. Rich in nature and wildlife, the area is home to several parks, reserves and zoos in Brisbane.

The picturesque Mexican Pacific coast resort city of Puerto Vallarta has all what it takes for a great Mexican vacation: beautiful beaches with water sports opportunities from surfing to parasailing, warm tropical climate, coral reefs with good diving and snorkeling, golf courses, deep-sea fishing, wild nightlife, affordable shopping and beach resort hotels. On top of all that, there are also charming old town quarters in Puerto Vallarta with cobblestone streets and great restaurants, and Sierra Madre Mountains with great hiking and horseback riding opportunities.

Impressive and gorgeous, the South coast of Sardinia is a land to be explored and discovered: a seemingly never ending series of beaches, each one more beautiful than the other, perfect for spending long lazy days by the water. If you are a beach lover be ready to be in awe, as here you will find some of the most incredible in Sardinia. 
Cagliari, the main hub of the area, is the island’s largest city and happens to be absolutely stunning: if you have time, it’s definitely worth a visit. If nature is what you are looking for, don’t miss the Chia area with its rocky peninsulas and crystal clear waters.

Trinidad, the southernmost island in the Caribbean is a multicultural place that offers excellent beaches, vibrant nightlife, rainforests and mangrove swamps filled with wildlife and have great possibilities for trekking, kayaking and birdwatching. Trinidad is also a home to one of the most famous carnivals in the world, as well as the birthplace of Calypso and soca music, steel pan instruments and limbo dance.

The gorgeous and quiet southwest coast of Sardinia is a perfect holiday destination for those who want to enjoy lots of natural beauty, long stretches of white powdery sand, clear blue waters and an all round relaxing atmosphere. The two islands of San Pietro and Sant’Antioco are havens of tranquility and natural beauty, while buzzing, at the same time, with life and authenticity. Iglesias, the largest town in the area, is also very pretty, with its churches and well kept buildings, and shares with the rest of the region a nice and laid back atmosphere that will make you feel like you really are on vacation.

If you think that summer in Italy is all about crowded beaches and big cities with world-famous sights, think again: Calabria is a beautiful region in Southern Italy and the place to go for a holiday in touch with nature on pristine beaches and wild mountain trails. Alternatively, you might also choose to explore the many old towns and historical sights of the region, swim in the crystal blue sea, or explore the photogenic caves of Calabria.

The small beach resort town of Jacó in Costa Rica is a surfers’ paradise famous for its lively nightlife. Jacó also offers world-class sports fishing, nice beaches and interesting nearby nature attractions, making it a great, variable and relaxing tropical vacation destination.

The beautiful city of Perth is home to sandy beaches by the Indian Ocean in Western Australia. On the green hills and valleys of Perth you can experience the wonderful Australian nature and admire the amazing views over the city. Walking or cycling along the beautiful Swan River is an experience in itself. In the Zoo of Perth you can get a closer look at the unique Australian wildlife. There are numerous historical buildings and museums in Perth exhibiting the aboriginal culture of Australia.

The perfect retreat for those who are seeking unspoiled tropical beaches and virgin, lush rain forest, Ilha Grande was for a long time a leper colony and then a high security prison and therefore hasn't been developed much yet. If seclusion and beauty is what you are after, then this stunning tropical island will definitely strike a chord with you: there are no cars allowed, so peace and quiet are guaranteed.

If you are looking for great diving or snorkeling experiences, fascinating coral reefs, long sandy beaches and warm dry weather all year around, Hurghada is the place for you. This coastal resort town along the Red Sea coast of Egypt offers also great opportunities for sports fishing, sailing, windsurfing, and nightlife, as well as interesting tours to Sahara desert.

Los Roques Archipelago in the Caribbean Sea off Venezuela has an outstanding natural beauty with its pristine white beaches by the crystal-clear turquoise sea. Los Roques islands are also a Caribbean underwater paradise with colorful coral reefs, abundant species of fish and other marine life, making the area perfect for snorkeling, diving and fishing. If you are looking relaxing holiday under the Caribbean sun, Los Roques Archipelago is a perfect destination for you.

Situated a mere 12 nautical miles east of Santorini, Anafi is a picture-perfect paradise of white and blue houses, turquoise waters and blue skies. To this day, the island is proudly attached to its rural and authentic roots and gives visitors the impression of having traveled back in time, with its silence and calm remoteness. A vacation on Anafi means rest and relaxation, being surrounded by nature and feeling one with the Mediterranean. Even during high season ferries don’t reach the island every day, which can be a true blessing for those in search of a complete break from the hustle and bustle of everyday life. Anafi’s beaches, located for the most part in the south of the island, are protected from the “meltemi”, the Cyclades northern wind, and are a delight for fans of long stretches of sand and calm waters. The north of the island is more rugged and isolated, ideal for visitors who seek even more solitude. All around the island free camping and nudism are still fairly common, yet another sign that time seems to have stopped on Anafi. Keep in mind that the beaches are not organized or patrolled, so don’t choose this island if tourist beach facilities are important to you.

Located in the center of the Cyclades islands, Paros might very well be the most likeable of the Cyclades, as it charms both the surfer and the hiker, the elderly Greek couple and the young backpacker, the nudist and the more modest beach goer, the wallflower and the party animal. With its quaint old villages and hip beach bars, Paros not only has something to offer to everyone – families, couples, boaters, kiters, windsurfers and many others – and is also extremely well connected and easy to reach. Its beaches are stunning and plentiful and, even on the windiest of days, one can find a spot to enjoy tranquil waters. Paros’ natural beauty and its laid-back yet sophisticated atmosphere make it the perfect island choice for those who have never been to the Cyclades before, but also for those who are veteran island hoppers.

Mui Ne is a Vietnamese beach resort set along the beautiful long white sand beach is best known for its excellent conditions for windsurfing and kiteboarding. This tropical beach resort area is the sunniest place in Vietnam, perfect for beach holidays, and also hosts local market and shops as well as high sand dunes and nearby historical sites.

Breathtaking volcanic landscapes and lush rainforests for exploring, beaches for sunbathing, shipwrecks for diving, and colorful Melanesian indigenous cultures to admire, the South Pacific islands of Vanuatu offer something for everyone. All this makes Vanuatu a tropical paradise on earth for anyone looking for an exotic island holiday under the tropical Pacific Ocean sun.

Small and remote, the easternmost and northernmost of the Lesser Cyclades, the island of Donoussa is definitely off the beaten track, an oasis of peace and tranquility for those seeking the beauty of the Cyclades without the hustle and bustle of bigger, mainstream islands. With about 150 residents, Donoussa has a small island feel and everything there seems to move at a slower pace: other than the ferry that arrives at the harbor a few times a week, the impression travelers have is of arriving in a calm and remote Mediterranean paradise. Stavros, a picture-perfect Greek island village, gives the feeling of returning to a simpler, more genuine way of life. The amazing landscapes and the stunning beaches make Donoussa a playground for nature lovers, and while some beaches are easily accessible, others remain isolated, perfect for those who love free camping. The silence is only interrupted by the waves crashing on the shores, as traffic on the island is almost nonexistent. Keep in mind that there are no cars or scooters for hire (and no gas station) and that some beaches can only be reached on foot.

Famous worldwide for its beauty and for its unique atmosphere, stylish Capri is an amazing island with lots to do and lots to offer to everyone. Lush and green, the island is surrounded by amazingly clear water and the best way to enjoy it is from a boat, as Capri somewhat lacks beaches: you will be rewarded, however, with stunning sunsets, famous to be some of the best in the region and absolutely picture-worthy. Shopping, especially in Via Camerelle, is a favorite sport around here: you will find everything, from luxury jewels, to handcrafted ceramics, to the sandals that have been made famous by several VIPs. As the island can get very crowded during the peak of season, the best way to tour it is either by taxi, bus or scooter: if you want to avoid chaotic traffic, hiring a private car is not recommended.

Sandy beaches, coral reefs, diving, and surfing are probably not the first things that come into your mind when thinking of Japan. However, the subtropical island of Okinawa can offer all this and more, such as intriguing historical sites, healthy original cuisine and an interesting, unique culture. It is no wonder Okinawa is today a popular tourism destination for the Japanese themselves.

The main island of Seychelles hosts their international airport, capital city and 90% of their population. It is also home to great beaches, coral reefs, and forested mountain areas, as well as colonial plantation houses, museums, art galleries and a botanical garden. The capital Victoria is one of the smallest capitals in the world, containing a popular market, a clock tower, colonial buildings and a Natural History Museum. The outlying Sainte Anne Marine National Park is a popular place for snorkeling, and Beau Vallon is the most popular beach in Seychelles. Morne Seychellois National Park in the mountains of Mahé is popular for trekking and birding.

This little gem on the Indian Ocean is one of Kenya’s most loved tourist destinations thanks to its relaxing and low key atmosphere, amazing sandy beaches and stunningly clear waters. Nature is lush and beautiful, perfect for those who want to rest and enjoy all that the area has to offer: snorkeling is great in the Watamu Marine National Park, and so are kayaking and stand up paddling. Scuba divers, too, will find plenty to do and will especially enjoy the amazing Moray Reef, famous for giant eels and sea turtles.

Enjoyed by millions of foreign visitors annually, Costa Blanca in Spain is a great holiday destination with astonishing white-sand beaches, enjoyable sunshine, refreshing pine forests, and wonderful coastal towns with well-maintained tourist services. Costa Blanca is a great choice for anyone looking for an active beach life and the warm touch of the Spanish sun. So, why not book a flight to Alicante and enjoy the sunshine?

If you are looking for amazingly crystal clear waters, a fun atmosphere and a beautiful natural setting, Formentera would be a perfect destination for you: this stunning island in the Balearics has something to offer to everyone, whether you are seeking parties or relax by the water. Gastronomy, too, is an important factor to consider when choosing Formentera as a holiday destination, as here you will find great restaurants scattered around the island, as well as many beach bars and lounges to fully enjoy local products and amazing sunsets. And while Formentera is famous for its party atmosphere, you will also find plenty of natural beauty around the island if you are seeking rest and relaxation.

The Tyrrhenian coast of Sicily is a much loved travel destination thanks to its natural beauty, nice beaches and quaint sea-facing towns. Cefalù is the area’s main hub and most popular town: with a very distinct architecture and its maze of alleys, it sets the tone for the whole area: here you will find a friendly, down to earth atmosphere, a wonderful vibe and a well rounded offer when it comes to things to see and do. As you get away from the min towns, you will find lots of very scenic spots, where nature is untamed and untouched by men, perfect to relax and get away from it all.

This incredible peninsula, considered by many the “Norway of Arabia”, is a natural wonder of Oman, a place that nature lovers will definitely be impressed with, as it offers very unique and beautiful panoramas you won’t see anywhere else. This region, separated by the rest of Oman by a slice of UAE, is best explored by boat, as its coast is characterized by stunning fjords and inlets of incredible beauty. Musandam Peninsula is also home to some great trekking paths, as well as some resorts that are perfect for those who are seeing seclusion and relaxation.

When visiting Puglia, many overlook Bari, which is a pity, because the capital city of the region is stunningly beautiful and fun to explore: here you will find an old town that is a true gem, as well as a wide variety of restaurants and stores to chose from. The area is also famous for being home to Alberobello and its trulli, as well as a countryside that is dotted with beautiful refurbished masserie, old farmhouses that have been turned into luxury hotels. Trani, Monopoli and Barletta, too, are towns worth a visit: each has something different to offer, from a chic harbor to historical sites, making the area around Bari a very interesting region for a wide variety of reasons.
