Description: City of luxurious shopping malls, beachfront boulevards and a good amount of cultural heritage, the capital of Qatar, Doha attracts many with its diverse and modern facilities. If shopping and cultural attractions are not enough for you, you can also try water sports in Doha to escape the heat or an exciting jeep safari in the desert surrounding the city.

There are many famous beach resorts in Italy, but still nowhere else in Italy beach life plays such an important role in local culture than in Rimini, a popular seaside resort city by the sandy beaches and the sunshine of the Adriatic Riviera of Italy. So, why not join the fun and head to the sunny beaches of Rimini? Biking in the curving and hilly roads around the city is also great fun.

The beautiful province of Guanacaste in Costa Rica offers spectacular beaches, unspoiled national parks, towering volcanoes, and many outdoor activities such as excellent surfing, sport fishing, horseback riding, trekking and birdwatching, just to name a few. Guanacaste is also a popular region for North Americans for buying real estate.

Antigua is a sunny Caribbean island and a great destination for those looking for perfect white-sand beaches. In addition to its multitude of stunning beaches, Antigua is also home to colorful coral reefs for diving and snorkeling, historic sites, golf courses, as well as offers good opportunities for sailing, sports fishing or tropical beach weddings.

Located just as far west as you can go in Australia, the small town of Exmouth is one of the remote places some would find situated in the middle of nowhere. However, the astonishing natural beauty of the area, with emus, kangaroos and rugged limestone landscapes of Cape Range National Park make the place a real discovery for a nature-lover. Exmouth lies on pristine coastline colored by Ningaloo Reef, a true diving paradise and an excellent place for exploring the wonders of Australian marine life.

Don’t let the size of Jost Van Dyke fool you: this tiny islet is not only beautiful, but is also a favorite destination with many rich and famous visitors. There isn’t much on the island: covered in lush jungle, blessed with white powdery sand, Jost is a dream come true for those seeking a true Caribbean paradise. Here visitors will find a few pretty guesthouses, some restaurants, and a very famous beach bar that has been attracting travellers for decades thanks to its picture perfect background, se facing hammocks and amazingly laid back atmosphere.

Country: United States of America: Hawaii USA
Description: Home to the world-famous Waikiki Beach, Honolulu is the main tourism destination in Hawaii. This tropically warm city surrounded by volcanic mountains and the glimmering Pacific Ocean offers popular beaches, green golf courses and great opportunities for shopping and nightlife. Surfing around the city is excellent, and Honolulu is also home to a variety of historical and cultural attractions from the famous war memorials in Pearl Harbour to a great variety of museums and theaters.

The old imperial capital of Vietnam, the city of Hue is famous for its impressive historical monuments and architecture that have been declared a World Heritage Site. In addition to historical attractions and Buddhist temples, Hue also hosts several museums and is a good place for shopping traditional Vietnamese handicrafts or sampling the local imperial cuisine.

Grand Bahama is a Caribbean island destination close to Florida with great sandy beaches, world-class resort hotels, warm water and sunshine, as well as bargain tax-free shopping. You can find plenty of activities on Grand Bahama from water sports and excellent diving, snorkeling and deep-sea fishing to kayaking, golf and tennis.

Taveuni, Fiji’s third largest island, is famous for its green nature, some of the best bird watching in Fiji, as well as excellent scuba diving. The island is home to the Bouma National Heritage Park, renowned for its ecotourism and trekking possibilities - perfect for nature lovers that want to explore the wildest sides of Fiji. The vegetation here is lush and exploding with flowers in bloom, and the hilly landscape is perfect for hikes that can lead to amazing deserted beaches, stunning waterfalls and uncharted natural treasures. Snorkelers and divers, too, will rejoice, as the reefs around this island are simply wonderful and buzzing with life and underwater activity.

A relaxing tropical island hideaway in Cuba, Cayo Coco is home to excellent beaches and large coral reefs great for diving, offering opportunities for water sports such as kayaking and windsurfing, all-inclusive beach resort hotels, as well as mangrove areas with birds and wildlife. Cayo Coco is a perfect place for relaxation, but do not expect to find typical Cuban culture here, as it is a small resort island with no permanent inhabitants.

The French Indian Ocean Island of Reunion is a hidden tropical gem that is home to mighty volcanic mountains with excellent trekking, secluded beaches, coral reefs for snorkeling and diving, and chic towns with an interesting blend of cultures. Not well known outside France, Réunion is an unspoiled tropical paradise with modern facilities and services, perfect for those looking for an exotic beach holiday with outdoor activities.[b]Large volcanic island[/b] and a French overseas territory, Réunion is located in the Indian Ocean east of Madagascar. The island has a similar history with the nearby Mauritius and Seychelles and is inhabited by an interesting ethnic mixture with people of Indian, African, Chinese, and French ancestry. As part of France, Reunion belongs to the Euro zone and the European Union. The island has become a popular holiday destination for French people, but does not receive much tourism outside mainland France.

The small laid-back Caribbean island of Caye Caulker off the coast of Belize is a great vacation destination for snorkeling and diving in the warm and clear Caribbean waters. The coral reefs near the island are famous among divers worldwide. Caye Caulker is also home to white-sand beaches and beach bars, and offers nice sea kayaking, and manatee and birdwatching. The slow pace of life with no hurry or stress is also among the best parts of the island.

Santo Domingo, the capital of the Dominican Republic is the oldest city in the New World. Founded in 1498 by Christopher Columbus's brother Bartholomew, the city contains numerous historical treasures like the fist cathedral in the Western Hemisphere, where the remains of Columbus himself are said to be buried. Located in the Caribbean along the South coast of the island of Hispaniola, Santo Domingo offers cultural and culinary attractions, as well as plenty of nightlife options.

Those who like variety should look no further than the amazing west coast of Mauritius, where the most diversity is to be found. Diving is truly great around here, as the underwater is world is as interesting as it gets, and the flat and sandy bays are especially popular with families, as the beaches slope gently into a sea of green. The Black River Gorges National Park, with its incredible fauna, is also a must see in the region, as is the lovely and quaint town of Chamarel, with its colonial atmosphere and relaxed vibes.

At the westernmost tip of the Japanese archipelago, the Yaeyama Islands are remote and beautiful, with a wild and rugged nature that leaves visitors speechless and makes them fall in love at first sight. Characterized by lush mangroves, forests, peaks, white sandy beaches and crystalline waters, these islands are truly a dream come true for those who want to get away from it all and experience life in contact with nature. Here visitors come to relax, to rest and to feel regenerated by the exquisite peace and calm that can be found all around the archipelago: if isolation and silence is what you are looking for, this is the place for you.

Phi Phi Island has long been a favorite with travellers looking for crystal clear waters, white soft sand, and lush palm trees. The hub of the island, the center of Phi Phi Don, has unfortunately been overdeveloped, and while it offers a lot to do wen it comes to restaurants, bars and shops, it has lost a lot of its tropical charm. Elsewhere on the island, however, you can find unspoiled coves and reefs, perfect for swimming and enjoying the sun.  If you want to experience even more peace and quiet, the nearby island of Phi Phi Leh is a wonderful destination for a day trip.

State of sunshine and water sports, Florida is faithful to its image of endless beaches and active outdoor life, which are at their best around Miami, the suntan city located in the southernmost corner of the United States. Besides beaches and water sports, Miami offers also excellent facilities for shopping and entertainment, including vibrant nightlife. Miami is also a good gateway to visit the whole South Florida, including the Florida Keys and Everglades National Park.

Kenya’s second largest city and an exotic major sea port, Mombasa is located on an island lying on the Indian Ocean coast of Kenya, surrounded by lovely beach resorts. The excellent white-sand beaches of Mombasa offer great sunbathing, diving and other water sports. Mombasa is a fascinating mixture of different cultures with a beautiful old town with Arab architecture, narrow streets and colorful, busy markets.

If you are looking for a holiday destination away from it all, why not try Broome! A coastal town and wilderness resort far in the Australian outback, this remote little town in tropical Western Australia attracts visitors with its great, unspoiled beaches, excellent dive sites, fishing, pearl industry and the vast wilderness areas around it. Broome’s quiet beaches also attract a great variety of birdlife, and the sunset camel rides along the beach sure leave something to remember.

Ambergris Caye is the largest and the most popular of the good 200 hundred small islands (cayes) that dot the  Caribbean Sea coastline of Belize. Visited by almost 50% of all foreign visitors to Belize, it is also the most popular tourist destination of Belize.  After you have visited Ambergris Caye, you will have no problems to understand why!

Surrounded by wonderful turquoise waters, Gili Islands are a paradise of long white beaches lined by palm trees and offer a relaxed yet hip atmosphere, which makes them one of the top notch destinations in Indonesia. Around the islands many hotels and resorts are being developed and offer a rich variety of accommodation options, and nightlife too is an attraction, especially on Gili Trawangan. If nature is your thing, don’t miss the unique experience of swimming with turtles, the amazing surfing conditions and the stunning sunsets that can be enjoyed all over the islands.

The colorful seaside town of Menton is a picture perfect resort in the French Riviera with a darling harbor and tall and skinny houses painted in a myriad of pastel colors. The waterfront is lined with palm trees and all around town citrus groves give the air a pleasant scent: everywhere in Menton you will enjoy a wonderful holiday atmosphere, which is chic but relaxed. Because the town is very close to the Italo-French border, here you will find a cuisine that is heavy on Italian influences, prepared with amazing and locally sourced ingredients. The nearby beaches aren’t very big, but they are sandy and nice, ideal for spending a wonderful day by the water.

Country: United States of America: US Virgin Islands
Description: The smallest of the three main islands, St. John has the best world-class beaches on the U.S. Virgin Islands and is a popular destination for those who really enjoy natural beauty. Two thirds of the island are protected as Virgin Islands National Park, offering great hiking, snorkeling and diving. Sailing is also very popular on St. John, as are shops, nightlife and historical sights that can also be found on the island.

A nature lover’s paradise island off the coast of South Australia, Kangaroo Island is home to unspoiled wilderness areas and unique Australian wildlife, such as kangaroos, koalas, penguins and fur seals. The golden, pristine beaches of Kangaroo Island by the turquoise seas are great for sunbathing and water sports, such as diving around Kangaroo Island. On Kangaroo Island you can taste delicious local wine, honey and seafood, and enjoy your holiday on peaceful natural settings.

Idyllic Caribbean islands with sandy beaches, turquoise waters and laid back culture, British Virgin Islands are a good choice for a holiday in the Caribbean sun. The British Virgin Islands are a popular sailing destination, but also other water sports are well presented in the coastal waters of these idyllic islands carrying British cultural heritage.

If you want to experience Vietnam in a stylish way, the beautiful peninsula where Da Nang is located is the place for you, as it is home of some of the best luxury hotels in the country. The most beautiful and popular beaches in town are My Khe and Non Nuoc, and there you will find everything your heart might desire for a wonderful, fun and relaxing beach vacation, including spas, golf courses and great restaurants. Da Nang City, only 20 minutes away, also offers a lot when it comes to culture, sightseeing and shopping, making this destination a very good choice for those who want everything within reach.

Endless beaches, scenic coastal landscapes, luxurious yachts, coastal villas, seaside boulevards and sunny climate. This is what makes Punta del Este one of the top beach resorts of South America, and the place to be if you want to spot the local rich and famous enjoy the friendly touch of the Uruguay sun. Punta del Este also offers enjoyable facilities for water sports, high-end shopping and gambling.

Looking for an affordable Caribbean diving paradise? Bocas del Toro in Panama offers a myriad of islands with white-sand beaches, coral reefs and unique wildlife, a good range of accommodation and restaurants, as well as a great deal of activities from diving and snorkeling to hiking and kayaking – and it serves all this with a relaxed Caribbean vibe.

If nature and wilderness is your thing, the south coast of Mauritius is the ideal destination for you, as in this area you will be amazed by the beauty of the beaches and panoramas. To see the amazing local fauna, an excursion to the Ile aux Aigrettes is a must do: there you can see pink pigeons and giant turtles in their natural habitat. Around this area you will also find plantations, waterfalls, rum distilleries and stunning beachside resorts: all great ingredients for a vacation that is both relaxing and filled with interesting things to see and do.

The Thousand Islands, also called Pulau Seribu, are an archipelago in the Jakarta Bay popular with Indonesians, but also worth a visit if you are traveling in the area. The islands further from the mainland are the most beautiful and the cleanest, as they feature nice white sandy beaches and clear blue waters. Accommodation is easy to find, as there are many resorts and bungalows scattered around the islands, and many beaches are organized with all sorts of water sports for those who want to stay active during their vacation.

The northernmost part of Puglia, Gargano is a beautiful and lush promontory covered in woods and dotted with pretty, traditional villages. The Gargano National Park, established in 1977, is not far from Foggia and includes Mount Gargano, the Tremiti islands archipelago and the Foresta Umbra, a beautiful wood protected area that is definitely worth a visit. Although there are beaches in the area, this region doesn’t have the same crystal clear waters of the Salento, but still shines for its natural beauty and offers visitors plenty of chances to relax and have fun in an incredible setting of medieval towns and fishing villages on the sea.

Casablanca, the biggest city and economic capital of Morocco offers some monumental sights as well as plenty of good restaurants, many shopping and nightlife options and nearby golf courses. This less visited city is among the biggest cities in Africa and is the most liberal and progressive of all cities in Morocco.

The Cilento, a beautiful area that runs on the coast between Paestum and the Gulf of Policastro and inland up to the Vallo di Diano, is a popular destination with tourists who enjoy lush nature, clear waters, a simple sort of life, but also good food and a bit of fun. Boat trips from Palinuro are a great way to explore the area, rich with inlets and caves that are otherwise impossible to reach, while the inland, dotted with villages and towns, is best visited by car. Gastronomy is, of course, another strong suit of the area, as many restaurants serve amazing fresh fish and other local pasta specialties. Olive oil, too, is an amazing local treat: the Cilento DOP is considered to be one of the best oils in the country.

The historic city of Kotor in Montenegro is famous for its spectacular old town with cobblestone streets and Venetian buildings. Located on the beautiful blue Boka Kotorska Bay and surrounded by magnificent high mountains, sunny Kotor offers excellent opportunities for water sports and outdoor activities such as diving and mountaineering. A typical Mediterranean coastal town, Kotor has a lively nightlife and is home to many romantic cafés and restaurants.

The Indonesian province of Yogyakarta is renowned for the ancient temple complexes of Borobudur and Prambanan, as well as for the palace area and rich colonial heritage of the city of Yogyakarta. In addition to historical sites, monuments, and museums, this interesting old sultanate in Central Java offers a lively art and culture, volcanic mountains, golf courses, and great opportunities for shopping. Yogyakarta city is also the main university center in Indonesia.

Small, simple and simply beautiful, the tiny island of Koufonisia is a sight for sore eyes, especially to those who are looking for the bluest and clearest of waters. Its stunning white sandy beaches are famous for being some of the best in the Cyclades: between beaches, the countryside never fails to remind visitors that this island is strongly rooted in its rural traditions. The charming port village of Koufonisia with its fishing boats and whitewashed houses is a small gem while, in the Hora, you will find small tavernas and shops dotting the picturesque alleys overlooking the Caribbean-like waters of the sea. The beaches, however, are the number one reason for visiting this small island: some are only accessible by boat but are definitely worth the trip. Kato Koufonisia, Koufonisia lesser island, is also reachable by boat and features some of the most stunningly beautiful beaches in the world. Don’t count on driving around, as cars are non-existent, but fear not, you can walk the entire Ano Koufonissi island in about three hours.

A wonderful island in the Bay of Biscay, Île de Ré is a great destination for those who enjoy holidays by the ocean and in touch with a nature that is wild, rugged and beautiful. The island is connected to the mainland with a bridge, making it an easy place to reach if you are driving. The beauty of the landscape is matched by an equally wonderful and laid back atmosphere: the villages on the island are pleasant and fun, home to amazing food markets and surrounded by marshes, vineyards and beautiful beaches. Île de Ré is also ideal for those who enjoy riding bikes and horses, as the trails to explore are countless. As this area is very popular with the French in the summer, you might want to visit either in June or in September to avoid the crowds and fully enjoy the wild beauty of the island.

The French South Pacific paradise of New Caledonia offers you lovely tropical beaches as well as rainforests great for trekking, unspoiled coral reefs with excellent diving and good possibilities for sailing, golf and windsurfing. You can also find interesting indigenous cultures as well as chic French cuisine, nightlife options and unique wildlife on these islands. With all this in mind, it is no wonder that New Caledonia has become a popular getaway for French and Japanese visitors.

Caribbean paradise islands offering enjoyable beaches, astonishing tropical nature and enjoyable water sport facilities, Grenada is an increasingly popular holiday destination. So, would it be sailing in the gem-like Grenadines, diving in the turquoise Caribbean Sea, relaxing on the palm-framed white-sand beaches or trekking on the tropical forest trails of this charming Caribbean island country? You decide!

Located on the slopes of the scenic Mount Carmel in Israel and overlooking the blue waters of the Mediterranean Sea, the historical city of Haifa is home to a beautiful old town and green gardens. This large town in Northern Israel also has beautiful beaches and a vibrant cultural and entertainment scene with theaters, clubs, fine restaurants and outdoor cafes.

Sunny island off the African coast with high class tourist facilities and some of the best beaches of Europe, Tenerife is what many of us think of as a beach holiday paradise. It is the largest island in the Spanish archipelago of Canary Islands and one of the top holiday destinations in Europe. Tenerife is also a mountainous natural paradise with majestic Teide Volcano overlooking the highly popular coastal resorts at its feet.

Viti Levu is Fiji’s biggest island, and also home to Fiji’s largest cities as well as both international airports. Situated in the sunny West coast of Viti Levu, Nadi is the hub of tourism in Fiji with the international airport, beach resorts, fishing charters and boat and air connections to the nearby Mamanuca and Yasawa islands. Fiji's second largest city, Lautoka is nearby with its Garden of the Sleeping Giant and easy reach to the Koroyanitu National Heritage Park in the mountainous interior of the island. On the south side of Viti Levu, the Coral Coast area offers beaches, a popular zoo and the amazing Sigatoka sand dunes.

The Cayman Islands are a group of three Caribbean islands - Grand Cayman, Little Cayman and Cayman Brac –located south of Cuba and northwest of Jamaica. The largest island, Grand Cayman has most of the population and tourist facilities, but the other two islands are also important diving and beach vacation destinations, especially for those who seek peace and quiet. Thanks to their beautiful white beaches and powdery sand, the islands are a popular tourism destination with many cruise ships mooring in front of Grand Cayman.

A wonderful place for surfers because of its year round temperatures and conditions, Siargao is a much-loved destination by many water sports fans that flock here in search of perfect waves. But this wonderful island has more to offer: especially when it comes to nature, it has everything one could ask for, from lush mangroves to stunning rock formations and a lively wildlife, ideal for photography buffs. The vibe around the island is relaxed and low-key and the international atmosphere makes for a wonderful vacation spot, no matter what you are looking for.

Called simply “Paradise” by the Aboriginal people, Fraser Island off the coast of Queensland, Australia, is the world’s largest sand island and a World Heritage Site that hosts vast, unspoiled sandy beaches, ancient rainforests, interesting wildlife, and excellent opportunities for hiking and sunbathing. Fraser Island can be toured by 4WD vehicles by driving along the beaches.

Once a quiet fishing village, Porto de Galinhas has recently become one of Brazil's most popular destinations thanks to its amazing clear waters, beautiful lush vegetation and fun, laid-back atmosphere. The white sandy beaches are the town's main attraction, but also the relaxed vibe and waterfront restaurants are great reasons to pick it as a destination.

Californian beach city next to the Mexican border, San Diego is a fascinating combination of natural and cultural draws. In this sunny city you can find highly popular zoos and excellent shopping facilities as well as miles of enjoyable beaches with excellent water sports opportunities, and treasures connected with local culture and history. Apart from that, San Diego offers good facilities also for entertainment and outdoor sports, and makes a good starting point for a day tour to Mexico’s Tijuana.

The only major seaside city in Cambodia, Sihanoukville is home to lovely, wide beaches, nearby tropical islands, opportunities for diving or snorkeling, and wildlife in the nearby national parks, as well as very affordable dining and accommodation options. After 30 years of decline, Sihanoukville is now being developed into one of Southeast Asia’s new beach holiday destinations.

The Gulf of Oristano, wide and beautiful, is a wonderful area of Sardinia that looks to the West and is naturally gifted with understated beauty, clear waters and, of course, magical sunsets. Oristano is the only real town you will find in the area and you will be pleasantly surprised by its chic but relaxed atmosphere, its beautiful buildings and the abundance of retaurants and cafés- Speaking of food, the area is also home to Cabras, the fishermen village where the famous and delicious bottarga is produced. Also, don’t miss the Su Nuraxi nuraghe, considered to be one of the most interesting and well kept in Sardinia.

Should you be looking for a scenic coastal destination full of natural beauty and of cultural importancefaraway from the hustle of the big cities, Cinque Terre on the Ligurian Coast of Italy might be the perfect choice. This interesting destination and World Heritage Site comprised of a national park with five coastal villages shows you the side of Italy that has stayed true to its roots and maintained its originality, making Cinque Terre a great choice for an outdoor lover.

A unique combination of great white sand beaches and a scenic seaside archaeological site, Tulum in the tropical Caribbean coast of Mexico introduces you ancient Mayan culture and some of the best beaches in Mexico with powdery white sand, palm trees and tropical sun. More than that, there are beach bars and nightclubs, coral reefs, mangrove lagoons and underwater caves around Tulum waiting to be explored by diving, snorkeling or kayaking. Affordable beach cabins are available as well as hotels on this beautiful part of the Mayan Riviera.

The premier beach resort in Morocco, Agadir is famous for its wide, sandy beaches and plentiful sunshine. You can also find nightlife, inexpensive prices, great surfing conditions, numerous water sport activities such as paragliding, as well as sports fishing and golf in Agadir. The vast Saharan desert is also nearby.

The fascinating island of Praslin is everything one might imagine and hope for in a tropical paradise: blessed with gorgeous powdery sand and water that is an incredible shade of turquoise, the second largest island in the Seychelles is a dream come true. There is a great variety of activities to partake in while vacation in Praslin: numerous boat excursions offer the chance to explore its beautiful surroundings, while diving and snorkeling give visitors the chance to admire the incredible variety of the island’s underwater world.

If paradise is what you are dreaming of for your next vacation, then the Mamanuca islands –also called the Mamanuca Group- is the ideal destination for you. The crystal clear waters that surround the islands are perfect for snorkeling and diving, and the powdery white sand and beaches fringed with palm trees are ideal for taking it easy and relaxing. The islands are dotted with all sorts of resorts, so whether you are looking for a budget accommodation, a luxury romantic resort or a hotel for a family vacation, you won’t be disappointed.

The beautiful seaside resort of Belek, on the Turkish Riviera, is popular for its amazingly white sandy beach, which attract every year many beach and nature lovers. All around town you will also find plenty of large hotels and resorts with swimming pools, water parks, umbrellas, chairs, bars and all other kinds of amenities for those who want to have fun by the water. In the area there are also golf courses of all lengths and levels, and the resort is close to some incredible ancient ruins that will make golfing enthusiasts and history buffs happy.

The nightlife capital of Cyprus, the seaside resort of Ayia Napa is home to stunning golden sand beaches great for sunbathing, beach parties, swimming and water sports. The Central Square of Ayia Napa is packed with taverns, restaurants, bars, clubs and shops. Famous for its beaches and nightlife, Ayia Napa is also a good base for day trips to other fascinating Cypriot destinations.

Ascona is beautiful and has lots of personality. The town has the right size to be explored on foot: the streets and alleys are incredibly quaint, dotted with stores and boutiques, cafés and restaurants, and are ideal for strolling. The promenade by the lake, with its bright colored houses, is picture perfect and the lake itself is an idyllic backdrop. Those who enjoy watersports can practice them during the long summer months, while those who prefer walking and biking can take advantage of the many panoramic routes around town. Gastronomy, too, is something to be enjoyed in and around Ascona: the region offers a great variety of restaurants, from gourmet eateries to traditional grottos, as well as producers that offer the chance to taste local products and wines.

Coastal city surrounded by hills with wooden Victorian-style houses, Wellington is a pleasant sight offering interesting cultural attractions. This capital city of New Zealand is also home to excellent tourism services and diverse attractions ranging from shopping arcades and entertainment facilities to zoo. The Botanical gardens and a scenic cable car lift taking you enjoy the views over the city are also must-sees in Wellington.

The five islands that make up the Surin archipelago are a true wonder of nature, so much so that they have been declared a Marine National Park. Here visitors will find amazing crystal clear waters with such an incredible visibility that exploring the underwater world around them is an absolute pleasure and a must do in the area, whether is by diving or snorkeling. The islands are also home to incredible beaches with powdery white sand, secluded bays and paths that are perfect for hiking and spotting the incredibly diverse wildlife that inhabits the archipelago... so don’t forget your camera!

The beautiful and wild east coast of Sardinia, Italy’s less populated province, is a place of long beaches, caves and stunning panoramas.
There are no big towns here, but a series of smaller villages, all of which are on the quieter side and perfect for those who want to make the most of their days and don’t mind spending quiet, relaxing nights. The wonderful Golfo di Orosei, with its many “cale”, is a natural paradise with the most incredible water you will ever see: best explored by boat, it makes for the ideal destination for adventure lovers. The region is also home to the Sentiero Blu, one of the most difficult and challenging trekking routes in the country: so keep this in mind if you are an avid hiker.
Ogliastra has grown in popularity only the last few years, but is still largely untouched by tourism and therefore is very authentic.

The stunning and lush island of Borneo, the largest in Asia and the third largest in the world, is a nature lover’s dream destination, as it offers lush jungle, white beaches, clear waters and an amazing flora and fauna. Most beach resorts and luxury hotels are located on Borneo’s north shore, in the Malaysian part of the island and they are great places to rest and relax, as well as ideal for golfing and water sports. Diving is especially incredible in this area, as the rich marine life will amaze you.

A lively town along the Aegean coast of Turkey, Fethiye offers you anything from beach life and water sports to ancient Roman sarcophagus and cave tombs. Apart from that, Fethiye is the beginning of a popular trekking route and creates a good base for touring the lovely countryside of Turkey. If you want to try some more adventurous sports, paragliding and sea kayaking in Fethiye are available.

A tropical island in the southernmost point of the continental United States, Key West in Florida is the place of magical sunsets, palm-shaded streets and pleasant sunny climate. The warm, crystal clear waters of the Florida Keys are just perfect for snorkeling, diving, fishing or other water-based activities. After a day on the beach or on the sea you can enjoy shopping before diving into the lively nightlife in Key West.

Tobago is a pleasantly relaxed tropical Caribbean island with lovely beaches, coral reefs and rainforests for excellent diving, trekking and birdwatching. Once known as “the undiscovered gem of the Caribbean”, Tobago has now been discovered by North American and European visitors and has become a popular vacation destination with tourism being the main economic activity on the island.

Puerto Escondido in the Pacific Coast of Mexico is famous as one of the top 10 places for surfing in the world. Besides its legendary surf break, this coastal town also offers beautiful beaches, great sports fishing and good possibilities for diving and snorkeling vacation. The laid-back Puerto Escondido also attracts with nearby hot springs and ancient Mixtec ruins, as well as with a nice variety of restaurants and nightlife. Bird- and whale-watching trips to the nearby lagoons are available.

Tropical Caribbean island with guaranteed sunshine, lovely diving facilities and interesting natural attractions, the sunny Dutch island of Curaçao is one of the places you could just as well call a paradise. More than that, Curaçao hosts also some fascinating cultural attractions and well-maintained tourist services, not to mention its beautiful volcanic landscapes.

If you are looking for a picture perfect Caribbean destination with white sandy beaches, azure waters, low-key beach bars and a sophisticated atmosphere, look no further than Anguilla. This luxury loving island is not only beautiful and fun, but is also home to some amazing hotels, resorts and villas, perfect for those who want to vacation in style and don’t mind blowing their budget. A much loved destination with sailors, Anguilla is characterized by a very international and upscale clientele, so here you will also find some incredible restaurants and luxury lounges.

The Persian Gulf emirate of Abu Dhabi is a modern, multicultural city state with excellent beaches with warm waters and sunshine, great shopping possibilities, golf courses and marinas, luxury hotels and fine dining opportunities. The city of Abu Dhabi is surrounded by vast scenic deserts, coral reefs and mangrove swamps.

Although China may not be the first country one thinks about when it comes to beach vacations, but the seaside resorts of Sanya and Hainan are not to be missed! Both located on the eponymous island of Hainan, they are different in nature. Sanya is busy, ultra organized and very popular with Russian tourists, who mainly flock there from Moscow. The rest of the island of Hainan is more nature oriented and offers golden sand beaches and plenty of occasions to rest and relax.

The Maldives are a true tropical paradise with lagoons, crystal-clear turquoise sea, and white-sand beaches fringed with palm trees. A perfect destination for scuba divers, the Maldives are home to exceptionally rich marine life with abundant colorful fish species, breathtaking coral reefs, and fascinating underwater caves. The luxurious resorts and spas in the Maldives are ideal for relaxation and leisure.

Diving paradise on the Mexican Caribbean coast, the peaceful island of Cozumel is famous for its long sandy beaches and extensive coral reefs with a great variety of marine life. Besides diving and snorkeling in Cozumel waters, you can also visit old Mayan ruins, go fishing or on a glass-bottom boat tour, kayak, swim with the dolphins, see the island’s unique wildlife, or just relax on the beach.

Diverse landscape with tropical forests, hot springs, hills and valleys make Kenting National Park in Southern Taiwan an ideal destination for outdoor activities such as hiking and biking. Beautiful beaches by the blue sea with coral reefs and rich marine life are perfect for swimming, snorkeling, diving and other water sports activities. Pleasant tropical climate and the magnificent scenery in the cozy Kenting region attract millions of visitors each year.

God´s gift to Honduran tourism, the Bay islands (Roatán) on the Caribbean Northern coast of Honduras are known as hosting the second largest barrier reef of the world. Combined with the inviting depths of the Azure blue Caribbean Sea, nice beaches and affordable accommodation, it is no wonders that divers from all around the world find these enjoyable islands a paradise on earth. All three Bay Islands are popular destinations for diving and snorkeling purposes.

The Abacos Islands of the Bahamas are a laid-back Caribbean getaway located close to Florida in perfect settings for tranquil beach holidays. In addition to the lovely beaches, the Abacos are offering historical villages and excellent opportunities for sailing, diving, fishing and kayaking as well as golf courses. The Abacos are also home to a variety of attractions from coral reefs and national parks to a private resort island of the Disney Cruise Line.

Bermuda is a group of subtropical paradise islands with pink beaches, blue sea and natural beauty. The clear waters of the Atlantic Ocean rich in shipwrecks, coral reefs and colorful fish species provide excellent snorkeling and scuba diving around Bermuda. A favorite beach holiday destination, Bermuda is also home to numerous fortresses, museums and the oldest continually inhabited British town in the Western Hemisphere.

The increasingly popular beach resort town of Manuel Antonio has grown on the side of one of the most popular national parks in Costa Rica, Manuel Antonio National Park, offering some of the best beaches in Central America, as well as rainforests teeming with wildlife and activities from hiking to rafting, diving and snorkeling, and from horseback riding to canopy tours and mountain biking.

A wild and beautiful area of Tuscany, Maremma borders with Lazio, and unlike most Tuscan regions, it still isn’t too popular with tourists. If you love rugged and unspoiled panoramas, this is the place for you: with its discreet charm and low-key atmosphere, it’s the perfect place to rest and relax away from the crowds. Foodies, too, will fall in love with Maremma and its amazing gastronomy: meat lovers in particular can enjoy amazing beef and boar dishes, as well as great local wines.

Crete is the largest and one of the most beautiful of the Greek islands, located in the Mediterranean Sea south of the mainland Greece. Sun, sand and sea on its beautiful coastline are the major attractions on Crete. However, the island is very diverse in nature with impressive mountains, semi-deserts, and green forests, offering plenty of opportunities for outdoor activities. The fascinating Cretan history, culture, and hospitable inhabitants attract visitors to this lovely holiday island.

Extremely popular and packed with large hotels and sea side resorts, the region around Heraklion is not the most quaint, at least not on the coast, where you will only find super organized beaches and tons of accommodation options. The town of Heraklio, on the other hand, is incredibly lively, with tons of historical sites and a great atmosphere. Don’t miss the Archeological museum and the Minoan Palace in Knossos if you are a history buff, while if you enjoy tasting wine keep in mind that winemaking is becoming a serious business in the area, and there are plenty of places where you can the local production.

The Greek island of Rhodes is home to beautiful beaches, lively nightlife and interesting ancient sites. The clear waters of the Aegean Sea provide good opportunities for water sports such as sailing and diving. Outdoor sports, museums, and city attractions are also well available on Rhodes, one of the most popular holiday islands in Greece.

Versilia, famous for home to the popular seaside resorts of Viareggio and Forte dei Marmi, is a sandy area in northern Tuscany where many Italians flock to during the summer. Here you will find super organized beaches with chairs, umbrellas, bars and restaurants where people like to relax during the day, while at night it’s easy to find something to do as there are plenty of clubs and lounges all along the coast. Shopping too is a beloved activity in the area, as are some sports such as horse riding and surfing, especially for beginners. Because of the sandy nature of its beaches, this regions is very popular with families, as kids can play safely in the shallow and calm waters of the Tyrrhenian.

An island famous for its sun, beaches, and wild parties, Ibiza offers activities for all tastes. You can spend a lazy day on the beach, try water sports in warm Mediterranean waters, admire the rural villages and spectacular caves inland, or explore the active nightlife of this small holiday island in the Balearic archipelago.

Koh Samui in Thailand is a long-time favorite destination for those seeking a tropical island paradise. Samui is renowned for its great beaches and clear blue waters and hosts varied nightlife, inexpensive restaurants, bargain shopping and many available activities from diving and sailing to elephant trekking and bungee jumping. Ko Samui is a destination with a broad appeal to many types of visitors, having both luxury resorts and budget accommodation.

The capital city of South Australia, Adelaide is famous for its festivals and wine. This lively city is also the business hub and culture centre of South Australia with endless opportunities for shopping in its modern malls, entertainment in theatres, concert halls, pubs and clubs, as well as al fresco dining in its fine restaurants. The golden beaches around Adelaide are great for sunbathing and water sports, and there are fascinating national parks to visit not far from Adelaide.

The coastal town of Essaouira in Morocco boasts long, sandy beaches great for beach holidays and water sports such as windsurfing, a fortified old town protected as an UNESCO World Heritage site and a range of historical sites and activities from fishing and camel safaris to surfing, hammam bathhouses and shopping in the souqs. No wonder this picturesque seaside town also known as the Windy City of Morocco has become a popular holiday destination during the summer months.

Galapagos Islands are a world-famous paradise for naturalists, offering a vast number unique wildlife that are not afraid of people, excellent conditions for diving and snorkeling, as well as unending beaches of marble white sand, tunnels of lava, active volcanoes and a pleasant tropical climate. Made famous already over hundred years ago by Charles Darwin in his theory of evolution by natural selection, Galapagos Islands are still a unique natural World Heritage site that is best appreciated by a cruise.

The small Atlantic Island nation of São Tomé and Príncipe is an undiscovered gem with empty beaches, lush tropical rainforests, volcanoes, and interesting mixture of cultures. These remote islands offer good opportunities for fishing, diving, trekking and wildlife viewing in a safe environment. As a destination that has been hard to get to, São Tomé and Príncipe still remains untouched by mass tourism.[

An interesting melting pot of cultures, Malindi is a very popular beach destination in Kenya, much loved by Italian tourists, who have been frequenting this resort for decades. Here you will find amazing white sandy beaches and beautiful crystal clear waters, perfect for lounging in the sun, snorkeling and diving. This resort is also popular for its very good food, which will make gourmands very happy. Other activities are available too, such as watersports and excursions inland to participate to exciting safaris.

The most popular tourist attraction in Vietnam, Ha Long Bay with its spectacular limestone islands and caves rising sharply from the sea is one of the most stunning natural wonders of the Far East. Named a World Heritage Site by UNESCO, Ha Long Bay is home to approximately 1,900 islands and islets that form the intriguing seascape of the area, perfect for scenic cruises, kayaking, and cave exploring. Besides enjoying the scenic beauty of the bay, you can also swim in its warm, clear waters, visit secluded beaches or local fishing villages, or admire the unique flora and fauna of the islands.

As the name suggests, Virgin Gorda is a round and plump island, famous around the world for its magnificent rock formations, called The Baths. Swimming in the caves formed by these rocks is an amazing experience, as is lounging on one of the many pristine white beaches around the island. Virgin Gorda has a great low-key atmosphere and is very welcoming with its quaint cottages, pretty restaurants and fun bars: if you are looking for a great holiday destination with natural beauty and plenty to do, this is the perfect place for a vacation you won’t easily forget.

Tiny country on the West coast of Central Africa, Equatorial Guinea is definitely not one of the most common places for spending a holiday. Who would have heard about its lush rain forests, astonishing volcanic landscapes, secluded African beaches or lively small cities? This small adventurous country surely introduces you to the wild and untamed side of Africa.

The sunny Greek island of Corfu is home to beautiful beaches and lush Mediterranean nature. The blue waters of the Adriatic Sea offer excellent chances for water sports such as surfing and diving, while the green countryside of the island is ideal for hiking and biking surrounded olive trees, cypresses, wild flowers, valleys, hills and mountains. In the numerous taverns in the historic towns and villages of Corfu you can taste the best dishes of Greek cuisine.

The small town of Cabarete in the Dominican Republic is famous as the best place for windsurfing and kite surfing in the Caribbean. This sporty tropical Caribbean vacation destination also offers excellent golden sand beaches and lively nightlife, a great variety of activities from surfing and golf to diving, mountain biking and caving, as well as a wide range of accommodation.

With its southern allure, mild climate and lush vegetation (including countless palm trees), Lake Maggiore is a romantic place for every visitor that discovers it. The lake stretches from the regions of Piedmont and Lombardy in Italy to the Canton of Ticino in Italian-speaking Switzerland. 
Various locations around the lake offer the perfect destination for those looking to enjoy the dolce vita amongst relaxing panoramas and quiet, natural surroundings. Don't miss graceful Stresa and the wonderful Borromean Islands on the Italian side, while on the Swiss shore the main attractions are Ascona and the tropical paradise of the Brissago Islands.

The island of Masirah, located off the coast of Oman in the Indian Ocean, is a true nature lover’s paradise, and what lacks in structures is made up in natural beauty. The rocky landscapes and palm lined sandy beaches are as quiet and tranquil as can be, and are home to an incredible variety of birds such as herons and flamingos, as well as turtles, crabs and many other marine creatures. The winds are usually constant and strong, so the island in the past few years has become popular with kite surfers seeking new adventures. There aren’t many hotels on the island, although some new ones have opened recently, as camping still is the most popular way to experience Masirah.

Incredible azure waters, white powdery sand and lush jungle: the east coast of Mauritius is a wonder of nature and a dream come true for those who want to be surrounded by incredible beaches and the bluest of seas. The area around the towns of Belle Mare and Palmar is home to an incredible number of luxury resorts, where holiday goers can enjoy everything their heart might desire: diving is amazing, and watersports too are plentiful, but one can also play a round of golf at one of the many courses. Spas, too, are an option for those who want to relax with an amazing view of the ocean.

The Western tip of Sicily, from San Vito Lo Capo to Selinunte, is a wonderful land of blue water and bluer skies, medieval and baroque architectures, windmills and salt. Trapani, the main city in the region, is a beautiful town worth discovering, nearby Erice is a picture perfect hilltop village with breathtaking views, while San Vito Lo Capo is famous for its beach, its couscous and the natural beauty that surrounds it. Further south, Marsala and Mazara del Vallo show two different but equally sides of Sicily, while the archeological parks of Segesta and Selinute are both an incredible way of getting to know the history of this amazing region.
