Description: With its frequent sunshine, beautiful tropical beaches, all-inclusive services and famous cabarets, Varadero is a summer holiday destination with popularity guaranteed. Not to forget the fascinating caves and the turquoise blue landscapes of the Caribbean Sea, which complement the attractiveness of this popular Northern Cuban holiday resort. As a resort enclave with restricted access to Cubans, Varadero might not show you the real Cuba, but it sure shows you the beach facilities of this Caribbean island.

Built on the remains of what once was the ancient city of Smyrna, Izmir is today the third biggest city of Turkey. It is a busy commercial center with business facilities, bazaars and cultural venues. All this added to the palm-framed boulevards and fine beaches, Izmir has plenty of qualifications that bring a smile to a visitor's face - especially as Izmir is located in the sunniest part of Turkey, making it one of the pearls of the Aegean Sea.

Green and lush with tropical jungle, surrounded by multimillion-dollar homes, the seaside resort of Naples is a real paradise for those who are looking for a sophisticated atmosphere paired with a great variety of outdoor activities. Here you can enjoy the beach, visit wildlife sanctuaries, shop till you drop or try a jet ski safari to see dolphins: the warm waters of the Gulf of Mexico are a fun playground for those who decide to spend their holidays in this area. The international vibe and the large number of restaurants make it a very good option also for those who want to enjoy great food after a day filled with adventures.

The most famous of the popular destinations of the French Riviera, Nice is the place where the French think the sun lives. This charming Mediterranean coastal city offers excellent surroundings for an active beach holiday with water sports and sunbathing. There is also a charming Old Town in Nice with nice art museums and historically interesting castle ruins. Shopping facilities and active nightlife are waiting for you in Nice, and those who like touring will find also inspiring mountain landscapes around the city.

The second smallest of the Canary Islands, La Gomera is a beautiful and wild spec of land with dramatic landscapes and volcanic mountains. Famous for its rugged beauty, this island is very popular with hikers, as it is crisscrossed with a great variety of walking paths and trails, surrounded by lush woods, steep cliffs and clack volcanic beaches. The sea around it is crystal clear and absolutely amazing, making La Gomera a great destination for those who enjoy snorkeling and diving, as well as other water sports. Not the easiest to reach, this island is for true nature lovers and for those who don’t mind spending quiet evening and nights during their vacation.

Is there any Mediterranean resort that is glitzier and more iconic than St. Tropez? Probably not. Since the 1960s, this French gem has been popular with the rich and famous, alluring them with its charm and beauty. Luxury shopping is a must here, as is fine dining, champagne and splendid beaches. During the day, the blue waters of the Med are the main attraction, at night, strolling by the harbor to see and be seen is one of St. Tropez’s most popular attractions. The area around town is also beautiful, and especially so when explored by boat, as the coast counts an incredible number of coves and hidden beaches.

The sunny palm island of Tunisia, Djerba is home to fine sandy beaches by the azure blue waters of the Mediterranean Sea, offering great sunbathing and water sports. In Houmt Souq, the beautiful seaside capital of Djerba with its whitewashed houses and Islamic monuments, you can visit colorful Souqs and small cafes. The picturesque countryside of Djerba is dotted with archaeological remains and small fascinating villages just waiting to be explored.

The idyllic and historical island of Samos is located in the sparkling blue Aegean Sea in Greece. The peaceful island is home to many secluded beaches, charming towns and villages, as well as secret caves, forested mountains, fertile vineyards, and green valleys to explore. The island of Pythagoras, Samos boasts fascinating historical attractions, including the ancient fortified port and the magical water tunnel of Eupalinos. Samos is also a good base for day-trips to the exotic Turkish resort of Kusadasi.

Different in every aspect from the rest of the Cyclades, Santorini is shaped like a crescent moon around the caldera, a volcano crater, with the main settlements built along its imposing cliffs. Don’t expect white sandy beaches, or hills that are rough and dry: in Santorini you will discover black volcanic sand and beautiful, lush vineyards. The capital city of Fira, although mobbed by crowds most of the time, is charming and beautiful, especially in the mornings, while Oia, traditional and romantic, is the best place on the island to enjoy sunset and top-notch food. Because of its shape and the distances between beaches and towns, it is better to explore Santorini with a rented vehicle: tourist season on the island lasts from April to November, so avoid August if possible, when the island is at its most crowded. If you like to explore and discover new places by yourself, then you definitely need to rent a car or scooter.

The coastal town of Pafos on the island of Cyprus, the mythical birthplace of the goddess Aphrodite, has something for everybody: pleasant weather, beautiful beaches for sunbathing and water sports activities, as well as impressive historical sites and excellent opportunities for shopping. With also amusement parks available, Pafos is a family holiday destination and a good base for touring the island.

A small island enjoying pleasant tropical climate, soft sandy beaches, and clear blue waters with turtles, sharks, coral reefs and much more, Sipadan is a paradise on earth for divers. In the coastal waters of this Malaysian island you can enjoy some of the World’s best scuba diving, or spend a day sunbathing on lovely beaches. As the island is a protected area, you will not be allowed to spend a night on Sipadan, but will be transferred here daily by boat from Semporna.

Country: United States of America: Hawaii USA
Description: Hawaii, or the Big Island, is the largest of the Hawaiian Islands. It is home to great diversity, from beautiful tropical beaches and rainforests to snow-capped mountains and active volcanoes. The dry western side of Hawaii is perfect for beach holidays, and the coastal waters around the island offer great diving, snorkeling and fishing experiences. Having two of the world's largest mountains and the most active volcano in the world, Hawaii Island also offers excellent possibilities for outdoor activities including hiking, mountain biking and horseback riding.

“My Kimolos, my heaven” – this is how locals refer to their island. Sitting between the bigger and better known islands of Milos and Sifnos, Kimolos is located in the southwest of the Cycladic archipelago. The Venetians called Kimolos “Argentiera” (silver), probably due to its silvery rocks in the south. The island was famous since antiquity for its “kimolia gi”, a kind of clay with medicinal and detergent qualities that Kimolos exported well before the 3rd century B.C. Famous for its beautiful and sheltered beaches, Kimolos is not a popular tourist destination and is waiting to be explored by those who like to vacation off the beaten track. Many tourists come from Milos only for a day visit since the island is small, but in order to explore its beaches and enjoy the traditional streets of Horio, the main village, you need at least 2-3 days. One of the greenest islands of the Cyclades, Kimolos boasts a great number of paths for those who enjoy hiking and is still quite rural: its people, rooted in tradition, make visitors feel more like guests than tourists, making it the perfect island for those who are seeking a home away from home.

The south coast of Sicily, stretching from Sciacca to Agrigento, is a land of wild and rugged beauty, often windy and with kilometers and kilometers in between towns and villages: it’s a place for those who like a little adventure and is definitely best enjoyed with a rental car, which will give you access to the most remote spots. The biggest attraction in the area is the Valle dei Templi archeological park, so make sure you add it to your “must see” list!

Group of 15 islands located in the South Pacific halfway between Hawaii and New Zealand, Cook Islands lie in the hot spot of everything that is associated with remote beach holiday paradise. Seen from any continent, these lovely tropical islands in the Pacific Ocean are surrounded by thousands of kilometers of open water. The water is so turquoise and in its abundance of marine life so inviting that you will have problems not to dive in it the very first moment you arrive at this high class holiday paradise.

A teardrop-shaped South Asian island nation, Sri Lanka is home to lovely beaches scattered around its tropical coastline. Ancient cities of great historical and religious importance and dense jungles hiding an incredible flora and fauna fulfill the mixture, making the beautiful Sri Lanka a great destination for the active and adventurous travelers.

The small island of Anegada is the quietest of the British Virgin Islands and is a wonderful destination for those seeking a peaceful place to relax and rest. Flat and incredibly different from its sister islands, Anegada features some beautiful guesthouses, a few restaurants and a very rugged and wild nature. Snorkeling here is amazing, as the water is crystal clear and the visibility simply incredible: if you prefer, you can just hang out on the white sandy beaches, lazily gazing at the flamingos that roam the salt ponds on the island.

One of the premier beach resorts of Tunisia, Hammamet offers fine beaches by the azure blue water of the Mediterranean Sea ideal for sunbathing and water sports. In addition, Hammamet is rich in history and culture with a medieval medina, whitewashed houses and colorful souqs. Hammamet is also a good base for day trips to other fascinating Tunisian destinations, such as the capital Tunis, the ruins of Carthage, and exciting desert safaris in the Sahara.

Home to spectacular white sand beaches, warm waters and tropical climate with 350 days of sunshine a year, Fortaleza is a popular coastal resort city in Brazil that is perfect for beach holidays almost throughout the year. Famous for its beautiful beaches, lively nightlife, carnivals and forró music, Fortaleza offers also affordable shopping, historical sights, vibrant local culture, cruises and good possibilities for surfing, kitesurfing and fishing.

Country: United States of America: Hawaii USA
Description: The charming island of Maui, the second-largest of the Hawaiian Islands truly has everything it takes to be a great vacation destination: a warm climate, excellent beaches, scenic mountains and valleys, lush jungles, historical sites, an interesting local culture, spas, golf courses and a great deal of activities from snorkeling and surfing to trekking, biking and whale watching. With all this, it is no wonder Maui has been continuously voted the best island in the world, as well as the best Pacific Island by travel magazine readers’ poll.

The largest and most beautiful of the Amami Islands, Amami Oshima features amazing secluded beaches and plenty of charming villages. This is a destination that divers should especially take into consideration, as there are some incredible dive spots that are still untouched and unsoiled for the most part. The nature on the islands is also a great attraction, as each of them has something different to offer: lush jungle, stunning caves, centenarian trees and a relaxed atmosphere.

Sun, sand and sea are the major attractions on the beautiful Greek island of Kos. In addition, the island of Hippocrates offers many kinds of activities for the whole family from water sports like windsurfing or snorkeling to archaeological sites and lively nightlife. Island-hopping from Kos to other Greek islands and Turkey are also popular among visitors to the sunny Kos.

The South Pacific island nation of Samoa charms with its excellent beaches and surfing, coral reefs with diving and snorkeling, volcanic mountains and rainforests, as well as with the traditional, laid-back Polynesian lifestyle. Known as the home of tattoo and Polynesian dances, Samoa is a major ecotourism destination with plenty of little family-owned resorts, offering a truly exotic holiday experience.

Probably one of the most famous Greek islands, Mykonos is known as the “cool” place to be, but it is much more than that. Visitors appreciate the relatively easy access of its amazing, sandy beaches and the very distinctive aura that the island has become known for: upscale and chic, Mykonos is all about fun, rest, relaxation and, of course, nightlife and glamour. The size of the island, the variety of its beaches and the range of activities offered make it a great destination for almost everyone - from those who want to sleep all day and party the night away to others who want to sunbathe on some of the most beautiful beaches in Greece. In the past, Mykonos was famous for being the premier Mediterranean resort for gay travelers, today, although still very gay-friendly, it caters to a more varied clientele. Because of its notoriety Mykonos is one of the most visited islands of the Cyclades, where one can rub elbows with an international and trendy crowd, especially during high season. During the low season things get a little quieter and Mykonos can be enjoyed at a slower pace.

Country: United States of America: US Virgin Islands
Description: The largest island of the U.S. Virgin Islands, St. Croix offers unspoiled sandy beaches, coral reefs, forested hills and small towns with historical buildings and shopping opportunities. The main attractions on St. Croix are the Buck Island Reef National Park that offers great snorkeling and diving, the St. Croix Aquarium, St. George Village Botanical Gardens, Estete Whim Plantation, the Cruzan Rum Factory and the rainforests in the northwest of the island. St.Croix is also home to golf courses, a casino and good opportunities for kayaking and horseback riding.

A remote island in the far eastern corner of the Pacific Ocean, Easter Island is a magical place famous for its ancient Moai statues. Easter Island is also home to a diverse landscape with volcanic craters, crystalline waters good for diving and surfing, and rich Polynesian cultural heritage. Outdoor activities such as trekking and horseback riding are also popular on this surreal Polynesian island.

A popular Atlantic island with dramatic green landscapes, a scenic coastline, and modern city activities, Madeira offers plenty of attractions to visitors. This Portuguese island is the place to go to if you want to take long walks along the levadas of the mountainside or to play golf in the middle of panoramic mountain landscapes. On the other hand, you can just as well choose relaxing by the pool or exploring the wonders of the local botanical gardens. If you have problems to decide, why not do it all!

Sicily’s capital palermo is a city of great contrasts that cannot leave a visitors indifferent: it is often said that you either love it or hate it, but loving it is much easier as the whole town is a playground ready to be discovered. The streets of Palermo, a  maze of alleys filled with the scent of meals cooking and with the voices of market vendors calling out their prices, are a sight on their own: just wander through the quarters of Capo, Ballarò and Vucciria to get a real feeling of the unique atmosphere of this equally unique city. Palermo also offers the opportunity to admire some great Baroque architecture, from the fountain i Piazza Pretoria, to the grandiose Quattro Canti. Food lovers, too, will definitely be happy: try panelle, the quintessential local street food, or sit down to enjoy some fresh seafood in the restaurants near the port: eating and people watching is as fun as visiting the rest of the town.

This super popular holiday destination is famous for many things, but above all for its party atmosphere, and for resorts such as Lloret de Mar and Cadaqués. This area, dotted with villages and inlets, is steeped in Catalan tradition and well organized with beaches, watersports facilities, restaurants, bars and everything else a visitor might look for.  Party maniacs will definitely have the time of their lives in loud and fun Lloret de Mar, while those seeking more peace and quiet will have a better time in Tossa de Mar, a more tranquil seaside resort. Of course this area is also great for foodies, who will definitely enjoy a variety of amazing dishes, especially those prepared with locally caught seafood.

Serifos isn’t well known (yet!) by international tourists, but Greeks love it, and there is a good reason for this. Still quiet and with a very authentic vibe, this island is beautiful and perfect for those who are seeking a relaxing vacation in touch with nature: here you will find amazing and mostly unspoiled beaches, with soft sand and blue waters, and also a very comprehensive network of hiking routs ideal for those who enjoy walking. The Chora, the main village on the island, is steeped in tradition and very charming, and the hub for all activities: here you will also find some typical restaurants to savor local cuisine and some bars to quench your thirst at night.

Sunny and warm? Yes. With beaches and water sports? Definitely. Just another ordinary beach holiday destination in Turkey? Not quite. Bodrum has all the before mentioned qualifications, but as an addition to them, this coastal town is also the home of the ancient mausoleum of Halikarnassus, a sight considered one of the seven wonders of the ancient world.

The world-famous Caribbean beach resort city Cancún in the Caribbean coast of Mexico is home to powdery white beaches and turquoise lagoons ideal for water sports activities. Cancún also offers some major tourist attractions and fascinating Mayan ruins nearby. In addition, this ideally located tourist city has a vibrant nightlife and good opportunities for shopping and dining.

The Pacific Island nation of Palau is famous for its excellent diving. The hundreds of small Palauan islands are filled with forests and mangroves, pristine lakes inhabited by jellyfish, as well as Second World War battlegrounds and waterfalls. Palau is also a great destination for activities such as sea kayaking, snorkeling and game fishing.

Komodo National Park in Indonesia is famous for its large Komodo Dragons, the largest lizards on earth. These dry volcanic islands also host some of the best dive sites in the world, as the sea around the islands is home to some of the richest marine life in the planet. Still a remote place to go, Komodo National Park can be visited by charter boats and diving cruises.

Caribbean Sea shores and white-sand beaches with palm trees, and enjoyable 30 degrees Celsius temperatures available throughout the year, Luquillo beach resort in Puerto Rico answers the call of all those who are looking for an enjoyable beach vacation destination only a short distance away from the vibrant capital city of Puerto Rico.

If you are looking for an exclusive tropical getaway in the Caribbean sun with stunning beaches and warm, crystal-clear waters, Negril offers you some of the best beaches in the West Indies. This laid-back resort area in Jamaica boasts the longest beach on the island. Activities to try in Negril include diving, snorkeling, golf and horseback riding, coupled with interesting nearby sights, good shopping opportunities and lively nightlife.

The southern part of the Sicilian Ionic coast is a stretch dotted with fishing towns and villages that, to this day, are strongly rooted in tradition and a very authentic feel to them. Catania, with its port and airport, is the main hub in the region and is also a wonderful town that is well worth a visit, especially if you want to see an incredible and lively market. The costal villages of Riposto, Aci Castello, Acireale and Acitrezza are also worthy of a stop, if only to admire the sea and enjoy a slow and leisurely meal, Sicilian style.

A fascinating port city by the turquoise Caribbean Sea, Cartagena is home to spectacular beaches and is also exceptionally rich in history. The beautiful colonial walled city and fortress of Cartagena are listed as UNESCO World Heritage sites. The most visited city in Colombia, Cartagena has lively nightlife and the inviting Latin American Music can be heard almost everywhere in the city.

When one thinks of Campania, the first thing that comes to mind is the Amalfi Coast – and for a good reason: blessed with one of the most amazing landscapes of the Mediterranean, this stretch of rocky land overlooks the blue Tyrrhenian Sea and offers everything a visitor might desire. Behind every corner the views are so stunning you will find yourself constantly reaching for your camera, and every town will charm you with its pastel colors, the scent of lemons wafting through the air and the incredible, almost palpable, energy that makes this region so very special. As popular as this area is, the best months to visit are those in the late spring and early autumn: still, even in August, the Amalfi Coast, although more crowded, will retain its beauty. Numerous passenger and car ferries connect the area to the islands, making the Amalfi Coast a good starting point to explore Capri, Ischia and Procida. Shopping fanatics should head to Positano, where they will find everything their heart might desire, from ceramics workshops to chic boutiques. Also, if you are an aspiring chef, you might want to check out the numerous cooking courses available in the area who will teach you to cook like a local!

The tourism capital of Jamaica, Montego Bay is home to one of the most famous beaches on the island with clear turquoise waters of the Caribbean Sea. This sunny resort city offers lively nightlife and excellent opportunities for sunbathing and water sports activities like sailing, jet skiing, cruising, fishing, snorkeling and diving. The nearby mountains offer also outdoor activities such as horseback riding and rafting.

When one thinks of Sardinia, the first thing that comes to mind is ritzy and glitzy Porto Cervo, the aga Khan’s playground, but stunning Costa Smeralda and Gallura have much more to offer than just a chance to rub elbows with VIPs. Here you will find a region that is incredibly well kept and has a lot to offer, from long stretches of amazing white beaches with crystal clear waters that have nothing to envy to the Caribbean, to beautiful spots to walk and hike, to bays that are perfect for wind and kite surfing. Accommodation options vary a lot: here you can find everything, from simple rental homes to 5 star resorts with infinity pools and butler service… and everything in between. The legendary beauty of the region makes it, of course, very popular: so try to visit it in the spring, when the area is incredible and in bloom, and skip August, by far the most crowded month.

Tauranga is a major beach resort town in New Zealand, offering miles of beautiful sandy beaches and a warm, dry climate, as well as opportunities for nightlife and water sports such as surfing, fishing and kayaking. Hiking and rafting are also popular activities in the scenic hills around Tauranga, and golf courses and excellent local wines add to the attractions of the town.

Beautiful white sand beaches, palm trees, high sand dunes and relaxed village life await you in Jericoacoara, a small tropical paradise in the Atlantic coast of Brazil that is the home of one of the best beaches in the world. Besides picture-perfect beaches and plenty of sunshine, “Jeri” also offers excellent conditions for windsurfing and kitesurfing, beautiful sunsets, warm waters and a lively nightlife.

A tropical Caribbean seaside resort town in Jamaica, Ocho Rios has all what it takes for an enjoyable beach vacation: wide sandy beaches, stunning waterfalls, lush rainforests, coral reefs for diving, colorful gingerbread houses, beach resort hotels, golf courses, beach bars and shopping arcades. Besides sunbathing on the beach, Ocho Rios offers a variety of activities from jeep tours to horseback riding and from nightlife to sailing and deep-sea fishing.

Nature lovers will fall in love with Redang Islands thanks to its lush jungle, amazingly crystal clear waters and powdery sand. The islands are very popular with those who enjoy snorkeling and diving, as they form a marine park of incredible beauty. The archipelago is also very popular with young travelers from Malaysia and Singapore, as there is a lot of different fun activities to partake in at the beach.

If you want to go to Crete but stay away from the large resorts and the crowds, the Lasithi area might be a great choice for you: here you will fine many quiet bays and beaches, some traditional villages, such as Elounda and Mohlos, and all round relaxed atmosphere. Nearby the coast around Plaka, the island of Spinalonga, with its ancient fortress, is also very popular with visitors, and gives an interesting insight into how different life used to be hundreds of years ago. Plenty of beaches in this area have very shallow waters, making it ideal for those who are traveling with little ones.

Ischia may be less famous than Capri, but it’s a lovely island with lots to offer and tons of personality to match: a must visit for those who want to spend a nice holiday surrounded by beautiful nature. Exploring the island is fun, either by car, motorbike or public transportation, and Ischia will charm you with its diverse landscapes, lively towns and happening beaches. If shopping is your thing, Ischia will not disappoint you: take a stroll down Corso Vittorio Colonna and Via Roma and take a look at the shops, or head to Lacco Ameno and Sant’Angelo to find designer boutiques.  The island is also home to many good restaurants – so those who are looking for delicious seafood, pizza and other local specialties are in luck! Natural thermal baths round up what the island has to offer: the various thermal stations on the island are very popular and they are the ideal places to rest and relax after a long day of exploring and swimming, and make Ischia a great SPA destination known all over Italy for its waters.

A touch of luxury under the warm Mediterranean sun offered by the modern infrastructure and by the image created by the world famous monarchy. A high class casino with lots of changing situations and incredible sums of money flowing inside its walls. World of speed and danger offered to you by a nearly legendary annual rally contest. Modern night clubs where partying is nearly a privilege, and duty-free shops where luxury goods are available at a reasonable price. Monaco introduces you a touch of life in the fast lane.

The main hub of the British Virgin Islands, Tortola is a wonderful vacation destination, as it has a lot to offer to those who visit it: its beauty is charming, with lush hills and flowers in bloom, and the variety of activities available on the island is mind boggling. Water sports fans can windsurf, snorkel and dive amazing coral reefs, while those who want to party will be happy to know that there are plenty of bars around, including one famous for its full moon parties. Outside Road Town, the main hub on the island, you will also find stunning beaches with white sand and crystalline waters.

Small tropical island surrounded by thousands of miles of open Pacific Ocean water, Bora Bora in French Polynesia is as close to a tropical paradise as you can get, especially as the white-sand beaches and the turquoise water of Bora Bora Lagoon make this French Polynesian island an enjoyable beach holiday resort with quality services available.

Stunning white beaches, turquoise sea, coral reefs and water sports such as diving, windsurfing, fishing and kayaking are among the main attractions and activities on Guam, the largest island of Micronesia on the Pacific Ocean. Guam has also variable landscape with coastal cliffs, mountains, waterfalls and jungles just waiting to be explored. This sunny tropical island is also a perfect destination for tax free shopping on Guam.

The wide sandy beaches by the blue waters of the South Atlantic Ocean are the main attractions in the sunny Mar del Plata, the most popular beach resort and an important fishing port in Argentina. Besides beaches and water sports opportunities, Mar del Plata has a lively cultural life with theatre performances, concerts, nightclubs and bars.

A lovely tropical island located in the middle of the Pacific Ocean, Tahiti is the best known of the holiday islands of French Polynesia. Therefore, this mountainous tropical island is the choice of those looking for tropical surroundings full of natural beauty, but with a multitude of good quality services and entertainment facilities available.

Known as the God’s Own Country, the state of Kerala in Southern India is a versatile tropical holiday destination with excellent beaches, cool mountain areas and lush rainforests. It hosts a canal and lagoon area known as the backwaters, as well as a myriad of historical and cultural sights and festivals, including shrines of many religions. Voted as one of the Ten Paradises on Earth by the National Geographic Traveler magazine, Kerala most likely has everything you hope for a great exotic holiday!

The friendly South Pacific island Kingdom of Tonga offers visitors great diving and snorkeling sites, and plenty of activities from sailing and kayaking to trekking and whale watching. Tonga is the place for tranquil beach holidays with chances to see traditional Polynesian way of life. It is a small and peaceful Christian country with deserted beaches and untouched coral reefs that lives up to the name Friendly Islands given by the explorer James Cook.

The spectacular long, golden beaches of the Gold Coast in Queensland, Australia, are great for surfing, diving, fishing and water sports. Apart from beach life, there is plenty to see and do in the theme parks, museums, and shopping malls of the Gold Coast. In the many popular bars and clubs of the Gold Coast you can party until the early morning hours. Hiking and other outdoor activities are very popular in the national parks of Gold Coast Hinterland, consisting of rainforests, valleys and waterfalls.

Picture perfect and pristine, Ngapali is a wonderful beach destination, with white sands, crystal clear waters and palm trees swaying in the wind. Here you will find a very relaxed and laid back atmosphere, perfect for resting and feeling one with nature, and a nice array of sophisticated accommodation to choose from. If you are looking for a lively nightlife, however, this might not be the right pick for you, as things in Ngapali tend to be quiet, especially at night.

Rich in history and architectural marvels, the first capital of modern Israel, Tel Aviv was founded in 1909 near the ancient port city of Jaffa, which is one of the oldest ports in the world inhabited since 7500 BC. A UNESCO World Heritage site famous for its modern architecture, the White City of Tel Aviv is home to many fascinating museums and magnificent old buildings, as well as lovely beaches by the Mediterranean Sea.

Located just a stone’s throw from Miami, Florida, Bimini is a small tropical island group belonging to the Bahamas with excellent big game fishing, diving and snorkeling, as well as nice small beaches, beach bars and duty-free shops. Caribbean islands that were once the home of Ernest Hemingway, Bimini Islands host also interesting mystical landmarks both below and above the tropical Atlantic waters that are said to be part of the lost continent of Atlantis and the Fountain of Youth. There is no certainty of this, so maybe you should come out and see for yourself!

The southernmost city of Israel and a port on the northernmost tip of the Red Sea, Eilat is a beautiful seaside resort surrounded by the scenic Negev Desert and the calm and transparent waters of the Red Sea. Eilat offers beautiful beaches and wonderful opportunities for diving, sunbathing and water sports activities, as well as lively nightlife, camel tours and birdwatching opportunities.

Tasmania is a special island in many ways. In the large World Heritage –listed protected areas, reserves and national parks of Tasmania you have great opportunities for admiring the unique Tasmanian flora and fauna. The fascinating and diverse Tasmanian nature with grassland, woodland, rainforests and moors is ideal for outdoor activities such as trekking in Tasmania. Many unique plant and animal species can be found in Tasmania, such as the famous Tasmanian Devil.

Chic coastal resort on the Atlantic coast of France, Biarritz boasts both some of the best beaches in Europe and the highest number of golf courses in France. This small seaside town known for its historical casino and great surfing opportunities also offers excellent restaurants, lively nightlife, as well as spas and therapeutic centers. No wonder Biarritz has been a common choice for holiday destination for both French and British royalty.

The original Mexican beach resort city, Acapulco has been offering its recipe for relaxation - the sun, sand and sea - already since the 1930s. Lovely beaches and tropical climate accompanied by a wild nightlife, a myriad of water sports from deep sea fishing to water skiing, shopping opportunities and the famous cliff divers, Acapulco still lives up to its reputation as a true Mexican vacation paradise.

The island of Phuket is a well-developed tropical holiday paradise in Thailand with great beaches, wonderful dive sites, lively nightlife, bargain shopping, and plenty of activities available from snorkeling and elephant riding to golf and fishing. The colorful and cosmopolitan island of Phuket is also called “Pearl of the South” as it offers excellent beach holidays with entertainment suitable for every taste.

If you are dreaming of a wonderful beach destination with white powdery sand and palm trees swaying in the breeze, Ko Lipe is the place for you. This stunning island is covered by a lush jungle, which will make nature lovers very happy, and is also home to a good number of wonderful dive and snorkeling sites. Thanks to its low key, welcoming atmosphere this island is ideal for every type of traveler, and especially for those who want to rest, relax and enjoy long days at the beach and pleasant nights chilling out at a beach bar.

A former fishing village turned into the biggest city in Tanzania, Dar es Salaam is a growing African city and the arrival place for many visitors who head into the more traditional Tanzanian tourist destinations such as Serengeti, Kilimanjaro or Zanzibar. However, before you go, it might be a good idea to spend some time exploring also Dar es Salaam with its lively markets, tropical beaches and historical buildings.

Neighboring island to Bali, Lombok is a tropical Indonesian island with beautiful beaches, some of the world’s best surfing sites, great opportunities for diving and snorkeling, interesting Muslim culture, and a mountainous interior good for hiking. As the island is quieter than Bali, Lombok has become a popular place also for honeymooners.

One of the most beautiful islands in Greece, Zakynthos offers secluded beaches ideal for sunbathing or swimming, and the azure blue waters of the Ionian Sea are exceptionally rich in marine life. The island has variable terrain with steep cliffs, towering mountains, and fertile plains just waiting to be discovered by trekking or horseback riding. In the lovely towns and villages of Zakynthos you can find many cozy cafés and traditional Greek taverns.

With its white sand beaches, lush jungle and wild nature, it’s no wonder that Phu Quoc Island is one of Vietnam’s best loved seaside destinations. If you are looking for a fun vacation by the sea, this is the place for you: the atmosphere on the island is carefree and relaxed, and there are plenty of occasions to have fun in the surf: here you can go diving to admire the reefs, rent a kayak to explore the island’s numerous coves or just relax in the sun – Vietnam style.

Country: United States of America: US Virgin Islands
Description: St. Thomas is the main island of the US Virgin Islands, and it offers great tax-free shopping and beautiful beaches, where visitors can go snorkeling, kayaking, horseback riding, sports fishing, sailing, windsurfing as well as surfing, playing golf and tennis. St Thomas is also home to Charlotte Amalie, the capital of U.S. Virgin Islands and a popular cruise ship port. The crescent-shaped Magen's Bay just across Charlotte Amalie is a popular beach destination. Sapphire and Coki Beaches are also lovely places to visit on St. Thomas. The island also hosts an ocean Park called Coral World, a Dutch fort built in the 1600s, and the historical Danish-built 99 steps in Charlotte Amalie.

The north coast of Mauritius may not be the most secluded, but it definitely has a lot to offer if you are looking for a fun place for your vacation. This is the area where you will find the most hotels, resorts and activities, as well as many beautiful beaches with white sand and crystal clear waters. To enjoy the beauty of the Indian Ocean, a catamaran day trip is a wonderful idea, as it takes you to swim and snorkel in amazing spots away from the crowds; learning to scuba dive, too, can be a great option. At night visitors enjoy a lively dining scene, with all sorts of different restaurants and cuisines available in Grand Baie for those who want to try the freshest local seafood.

Sifnos is simultaneously one of the most upscale and elegant islands of the Cyclades, yet it also keeps a low profile and retains a certain simple charm. It might look rugged and uninviting at first, but is actually exactly the opposite: the island features gently rolling hills, lush terraced olive groves, and a strong scent of aromatic herbs that wafts through the air. The architecture is traditional, yet embellished by local touches, the cuisine is distinctive and absolutely delicious (the island has a reputation as a foodie island), the people are friendly, and the landscape is simply breathtaking. The island is crossed by many paths, making it an ideal destination for those who enjoy hiking and beautiful natural scenery. Sifnos is a little gem, a place to discover and enjoy in all seasons.

If you want to stay clear of the chaos of Cancun and experience the beautiful nature of Mexico up close, then Isla Mujeres is the right destination for you. On this stunning island you will find calm azure waters, amazing reefs perfect for snorkeling and diving, and white sandy beaches that invite you to sit down and relax. When the sun goes down, there is still plenty to do in Isla Mujeres: foodies will be happy about the selection of restaurants available and, after dinner, party animals can have fun at the numerous bars and clubs.

Florida is not just all about Miami or Orlando: The sunny city of Tampa on the West coast of Florida offers you a great number of attractions such as beaches, theme parks, museums and zoos, as well as lively nightlife, great shopping malls, outdoor parks, a revitalized historic district and many golf courses. Tampa is also a popular starting point for Caribbean cruises.

The mountainous island of Corsica offers azure blue seas and some of the finest beaches in Europe, as well as enjoyable surroundings for both seaside holidays and active outdoor sports people, especially as the weather on this charming green island is pleasant most of the year. Corsica is a unique destination with a distinctive local culture blending Italian and French influences.

One of the most popular travel destinations in Croatia, the charming coastal town of Dubrovnik offers a famous historic walled old town, picturesque islands and beautiful beaches by the crystal clear waters of the Adriatic Sea. Dubrovnik is a first-class holiday destination that has good opportunities for entertainment and dining. Several annual cultural festivals are held in Dubrovnik throughout the year.

The tropical island of Bintan in Indonesiais a popular beach holiday destination close to Singapore with beautiful white sand beaches, rainforests, cheap shopping opportunities, and several golf courses. It is a tranquil place to relax if you are tired of all the bustle of city life in Singapore.

Tropical atoll islands located in the middle of the Pacific Ocean, Tuamotu Islands are a remote tropical holiday paradise known for their black pearls, offering a lion's share of beautiful tropical beaches and coral reefs boosted with peace and silence, offering an excellent beach holiday sites for scuba divers and all those wanting to get away from the modern civilization for a while.

Home to some of the most beautiful white sand beaches in the world, the small tropical island of Boracay in the Philippines is a perfect destination for a beach holiday. Boracay offers also great diving, snorkeling, kitesurfing and windsurfing opportunities, as well as many nightlife spots, shops, a nice golf course, and several spas to relax in. Sailboats, jet skis and mountain bikes can also be rented on the island.

The fourth largest island, Kadavu has famous dive sites, and is popular with those who want to enjoy an active vacation in a dream like setting. The island is quiet and unspoiled, with very few roads and even fewer cars: lush and beautiful, this volcanic gem is difficult to reach, but definitely worth the trip. The underwater world is amazing and incredible, with reefs that are out-of-this-world and an absolute dream come true for divers, but the clear waters of Kavadu are also ideal for snorkeling, sea kayaking and swimming. Accommodation, too, is varied: on the islands you can find everything from budget options to luxury eco friendly resorts, and everything in between.

Ko Lanta is a wonderful holiday destination for those who dream of incredibly long and beautiful sandy beaches, along with azure and clear waters and a relaxing atmosphere. Unlike in many other Thai islands, here you will find peace and tranquility as well as plenty of options to enjoy the wonderful and authentic local atmosphere. Those who are looking for a place to experience some incredible diving won’t be disappointed: Ko Lanta is home to many dive centers that will help them explore the stunning underwater world around the island.

If you are looking for a relaxed tropical beach holiday destination far away from the hustle and bustle of modern metropolises, the elephant-shaped island of Koh Chang in Thailand might be just the right place for you. Stunning beaches, waterfalls, jungles, coral reefs with snorkeling and scuba diving in clear tropical waters, trekking, spas and a variety of hotels on Koh Chang offer the combination for a perfect holiday.

Known as the City of Sails, Auckland in New Zealand offers visitors a wide range of cultural and historical attractions from beaches, golf courses and parks to day cruises and excursions to nearby Hauraki Gulf islands. The most popular place to stay in Auckland is the lovely harbor area where you can also find the photogenic Harbour Bridge, a symbol of the city.

Punta Cana resort area offers tropical Caribbean beach holidays with superb white sand beaches, tax-free shopping, fine quality cigars, rum and merengue music. This beach resort region in Dominican Republic is also famous for its golf courses. Punta Cana is a great place for a relaxing beach vacation, or you can try some of the many available activities such as diving, sports fishing or horseback riding.

The beautiful and mythic island state of Malta is rich in history with magnificent cathedrals, palaces, and ancient historical sites. Pleasant sunny climate and crystal clear waters of the Mediterranean Sea offer excellent opportunities for water sports such as sailing, diving and snorkeling in Malta, while the green Maltese countryside with picturesque villages is perfect for long walks and other outdoor activities. Gozo, the second biggest of the Maltese islands can be easily toured by regular and fast ferries from the main island. The major attraction in the town is the beautiful medieval fortification with cathedral and museums. Gozo is also home to the mythic Calypso's Cave.

“Green” might not be the first word that comes to mind when thinking of a Greek island, but Naxos might very well be the exception to the rule. With its fruit trees and olive groves, fertile valleys and sky-high mountains, the greenest of the Cyclades also features beaches that are some of the most pristine in Greece, interesting traditional villages and historical and archeological sites that are definitely worth a visit. Naxos Town, steeped in history, is one of the liveliest port towns in the Cyclades and never really shuts down, also making it ideal for those who want to travel in the low season. The largest island in the Cyclades, Naxos offers lots of variety, making it a destination for different types of visitors, from those seeking relaxation to others who love nightlife. It is also extremely well-connected and a great starting point to explore the rest of the Cyclades.

Sunny islands with scenic landscapes and fascinating culture that is a mixture of African, Portuguese and Brazilian influences, Cape Verde has much to offer for the increasing number of visitors who choose it as a their holiday destination every year. Here you can enjoy the endless sandy beaches of the popular islands of Sal and Boa Vista, the volcanic landscapes of the islands, water sports and golfing. The main island of Cape Verde and the home of most of its inhabitants is Sao Tiago, which also includes the capital city of the islands, Praia. With only 60.000 inhabitants, the capital of Cape Verde is a lively place with no huge tourist attractions, but with some enjoyable facilities for nightlife and shopping. The most famous event in the calendar of Praia is the carnival, which fills the streets of this coastal town with colorful parades in February and March.

Named after the famous scientist Charles Darwin, the tropical Darwin is the capital city of the Northern Territory of Australia by the Timor Sea. Hosting beaches and cultural attractions, Darwin also offers activities like game fishing and wildlife parks, and is a great base for exploring the vast Australian outback.

This beautiful archipelago of more than 800 islands in the south of Burma is a paradise for nature lovers, as its isolation from the continent means unspoiled panoramas, lush vegetation and crystal clear waters. The archipelago was opened to international visitors only as recently as 1997, which means that those who want to explore new and uncharted territories should definitely plan a visit here, although now things are rapidly changing and resorts and golf courses are being built on the islands. Diving is also wonderful around here: the best time to go is between December and April, when the weather is beautiful and the visibility amazing.

The coastal city of Recife is called the Brazilian Venice. It is a tropical historical vacation city with excellent beaches and coral reefs good for diving. Recife offers lively contemporary culture with arts, music and museums, as well as plenty of historical attractions in its colonial old town. On top of this, Recife also hosts great Brazilian carnivals and has nice possibilities for nightlife and shopping. The nearby beautiful beach resorts such as Porto de Galinhas and the historical town of Olinda right next to Recife are also well worth a visit.

A major Colombian tourism destination with magnificent beaches by the turquoise waters of the Caribbean Sea, Santa Marta and the nearby beach resorts offer excellent opportunities for water sports activities like snorkeling and diving in Santa Marta. The oldest city in Colombia founded by the Spanish, Santa Marta is an important port city with a colorful history. In addition, it serves as a gateway to the fascinating nearby destinations in the jungle-clad mountains and along the Caribbean coast of Colombia.

The remote tropical Caribbean island of Barbuda is home to stunning and deserted pink-sand beaches, coral reefs and seabird colonies, as well as a few luxury hotels and guesthouses and a quiet Caribbean village. This peaceful and unique island destination offers also great possibilities for diving and snorkeling, sailing, fishing and birdwatching.

Krabi Province in Southern Thailand is home to excellent white sand beaches, spectacular limestone cliffs, coral reefs with great possibilities for diving, as well as jungles, caves, waterfalls and over 200 islands. Krabi offers great opportunities for rock climbing, trekking and kayaking. Tropical Krabi is a relaxing holiday destination that is not as crowded or commercialized as Phuket, but still receives two million visitors a year.

With its friendly climate, long white-sand beaches, and well-maintained tourism services, Mallorca is an ideal holiday destination for those who want to relax on the beach or enjoy the vivid Spanish nightlife. Yet, this favorite holiday island in Mediterranean Spain also offers picturesque landscapes of lush green farmland and charming rural towns, stunning mountain scenery, and remote bays -not to mention the excellent outdoor sport facilities.

World-famous for its great dive sites and coral reefs teeming with marine life, the Indonesian city of Manado, and especially the nearby Bunaken Marine Park is a Mecca for scuba divers with great possibilities also for snorkeling. Friends of nature-based outdoor activities and native cultures will also be thrilled when visiting Manado.

A sunny tropical island on the East Coast of Africa, Zanzibar is something totally different from the African mainland. This increasingly popular holiday resort off the coast of Tanzania is a jump into the world of the ancient Stone Town and of devoted Muslim culture. Zanzibar is also known for its lovely beaches, various water sports, and exciting tropical nature.

With its historical treasures, sandy beaches and excellent entertainment facilities, San Juan attracts a variety of tourists from all over the world. So, why not dive into the core of Puerto Rico, to its capital city located by the Caribbean Sea, and explore the old coastal fortresses, enjoyable beaches, shopping opportunities  and lively nightlife of San Juan?

A popular Vietnamese beach resort city, Nha Trang is home to astonishing white-sand beaches, excellent water sport facilities, and thermal springs, boosted with some religious and historical sites. To please those who are looking for natural attractions, Nha Trang offers also uninhabited tropical islets with wild forests, secluded beaches, and mountainous inlets which make excellent destinations for boat cruises around Nha Trang, in the clear blue waters of the South China Sea.

Spectacular mountain scenery reflecting from the deep blue water of a mountain lake filled with windsurfers. Curving asphalt roads taking you through green pastures, wine yards and historical small towns. Cables lifting you up to the mountains, and taking your breath away in front of the stunning mountain scenery of the Italian Alps. Charming small towns with lovely beaches, and with friendly atmosphere welcoming tourists for a relaxing holiday. All this is available around Lake Garda in.

This romantic lakeside area has extraordinary places to visit, a concentration of colors and romantic landscapes. The villages to be discovered are many, some are iconic destinations such as Bellagio and Cernobbio, loved by intellectuals, artists and today enjoyed by the international jet set, inspired by a love of this scenic area. The beauty of these places, overlooking one of the most romantic lakes ever, fascinates and conquers the most romantic visitors looking for memorable places.

Often called the yachting capital of the world, Fort Lauderdale in the sunny South Florida is famous for its long golden beaches and numerous canals. Outdoor activities such as sailing, swimming, diving and golf are very popular in the sunny Fort Lauderdale. Once famous as the Spring Break capital of the United States, Fort Lauderdale’s palm-fringed beach promenade is dotted with beach bars, restaurants, clubs, malls and cafes which now attract visitors of all ages.

If you are looking for a windy paradise to practice your favorite watersports, look no further than Costa de la Luz, the western part of Andalucía, overlooking the Atlantic Ocean. This region is very popular with wind and kite surfers, and has a fun and lively atmosphere, perfect for those seeking an active vacation in contact with nature. The landscape, here, is dramatic and beautiful, with sand dunes diving into the blue waters of the ocean: the attitude is laid-back as are the structures around the region.

Ios might be known as a wild and crazy party island, but the truth is that there’s much more to Ios than meets the eye. Magnificent secluded beaches, long stretches of golden sand, quaint family-run tavernas and spectacular views are just some of the perks of this beautiful island, along with a top-notch local transportation system and frequent, reliable ferry connections to hub islands such as Santorini and Mykonos. Those in search of fun and a vibrant nightlife will definitely find what they are looking for in the lively Hora, where bars and clubs cater to all tastes and budgets until the wee hours of the morning. Not far from town, famous Mylopotas beach will appeal to those who love to sunbathe and want to partake in watersports, as well as to those who just want to sit at a beach bar and enjoy the views. With its wide range of activities and varied landscapes, Ios is one of the most versatile islands of the Cyclades that will please visitors of all ages and with the most diverse interests.

A stunning and wild island, Menorca is famous around the world for its beautiful beaches and crystal clear waters… and rightly so! The second largest island in the Balearics is, unlike its sisters, very quiet and ideal for those who want to relax surrounded by nature: here you will find less crowded beaches than in the rest of the archipelago as well as villages that are still rooted in tradition. Macarella and Macarelleta are the two most famous beaches on the island, as well as some of the most beautiful in the Mediterranean: ideal both for sun lovers and for those who enjoy watersports, they are absolutely not to missed. If eco-friendly tourism is your thing, you will be happy to know that Menorca prides itself in having practiced sustainable tourism for years now.

Stunning beaches, water sports, excellent diving and deep-sea fishing, wild nightlife, horseback riding and whale watching trips, and a myriad of luxury hotels and golf courses have made Cabo San Lucas a favorite vacations destination for many Americans. Located in the southern tip of Baja California, "Cabo" offers sunshine and warm weather throughout the year.

Probably the most famous area in the Puglia region, Salento is an endless series of golden sandy beaches, stunning rock formations and Aleppo pine forest that dive directly into a crystal clear sea. Perfect for seaside holiday thanks to its beautiful beaches, Salento also offers the chance to discover Baroque churches and picture perfect towns, quaint harbors and art masterpieces. Food and wine, too, make this area famous: there are plenty of seafood restaurants to chose from, (sometimes even too many!), and the Primitivo and Negramaro wines are an absolute delight, as are many other local products, making a true foodie delight.

The seaside resort town of Hua Hin in Thailand is home to great beaches, spas, numerous golf courses and natural and cultural attractions. Located a short distance away from Bangkok, Hua Hin offers good opportunities for water sports such as sailing, water-skiing, and windsurfing. Hua Hin is a popular tropical getaway also for Thai people, and even the royal family of Thailand has their holiday palace here.

The tropical Australian coastal city of Cairns is surrounded by lush rainforests and offers a wide range of exciting adventures, such as hiking, bungee jumping, whitewater rafting and mountain biking. Cairns often serves as a starting point to trips to the Great Barrier Reef, a diver's paradise off the Northeast coast of Australia. In addition, the city has a beautiful blue lagoon for swimming and sunbathing. Cairns truly becomes alive at night in the busy night markets, bars and clubs of the city.

The tropical island of Tioman off the East coast of Malaysia is known for its coral reefs with rich marine life, offering great possibilities for diving and snorkeling. This mountainous island paradise is home to great beaches, majestic waterfalls, and extensive jungle areas for trekking and wildlife viewing. Tioman Island is also great for activities such as rock climbing and surfing.

Have you ever dreamed of a lovely place to relax in refreshing surroundings created by white-sand beaches and turquoise sea landscapes? Do you think beautiful tropical scenery and warm climate would make your holiday enjoyable? How about some Caribbean rhythms to fill your heart with joy, and your mind with energy? Or the joys of water sport wonderland to give you a taste of adventure? All this awaits you on Barbados, added with nice golf courses, lively nightlife, tax-free shopping and interesting Caribbean culture.

An ancient city on the coast of the Adriatic Sea, Durrës in Albania is a quiet Mediterranean destination with lovely beaches good for swimming and sunbathing. Durrës is also known for its historic attractions, museums and theaters. The historic and cultural sights in Durrës include the largest Roman amphitheater in the Balkans and an interesting archaeological museum. Durrës is the main port of entry to Albania with frequent ferries from Italy and Montenegro.

Caribbean island nation with volcanic nature, Saint Vincent and the Grenadines are an ecotourism destination suitable also for a luxurious beach holiday. More than that, these less visited Caribbean islands are a great destination for sailing and diving, and a good place for enjoying the beaches, the Caribbean sun, and the lush tropical nature, which makes it very easy for you to forget the troubles of your everyday life.

As the name suggests, Antiparos is quite the opposite of its larger sibling, Paros: small, compact and relaxed, it is the perfect spot for a low-key yet fun-filled vacation. Its lovely Hora, closed to the traffic, charms visitors with its colorful bougainvillea, narrow alleys and laid-back atmosphere: on its streets you will come across small tavernas, little family-owned stores, and tourists and locals alike hanging out at Antiparos’ many cafés. Its beaches, too, are famous for their beauty and rightly so: some are quiet and remote, others have a more party-like feel to them, but crystal-clear waters and stunning landscapes are common to all. After the sun goes down, the island offers a good selection of dining options, along with the chance to have fun until the wee hours of the morning, making it a great choice for those who enjoy both sunning themselves at the beach but also some night-time entertainment. Although simple in nature, Antiparos has a certain distinctive style which makes it popular with some celebrities.

With its rolling green hills, lovely beaches, picturesque vineyards and lavender fields, Hvar is an island full of natural beauty. More than that, this small island off the Croatian coast offers you fascinating historical and cultural attractions that will easily keep you busy during your stay. Outdoor sports such has trekking and biking are also popular activities on Hvar.

City of beaches and fascinating cultural history, Valencia offers plenty of things to see and experience. This third largest city of Spain is home to architectural attractions, as well as lively nightlife and some of the most fascinating festivals of Spain. More than that, Valencia is the home of paella, offering you enjoyable culinary experiences.
